translated: to Ānanda, and to the bodhisattva mahāsattvas who had gathered from the ten directions, the Buddha said:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs rje chen pos sems can yongs su mi gtong ba dang / rtag par shin tu thabs mkhas pas khams gsum pa'i srid pa nyi shu rtsa lngar gnas pa'i sems can thams cad la bskal pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i bar du mnyam snyoms pa'i byams pa bsgoms shing /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs rje chen pos sems can yongs su mi gtong ba dang / rtag par shin tu thabs mkhas pas khams gsum pa'i srid pa nyi shu rtsa lngar gnas pa'i sems can thams cad la bskal pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i bar du mnyam snyoms pa'i byams pa bsgoms shing /
translated: With the great compassion of the Thus-Gone One, they never abandon sentient beings and, with constant skill in means, they cultivate equanimous love for all sentient beings dwelling in the twenty-five existences of the three realms for inconceivable eons.

original: btang snyoms dang ldan pa'i thabs mkhas pas spyod de /
analyzed: btang snyoms dang ldan pa'i thabs mkhas pas spyod de /
translated: With skill in means endowed with equanimity, they engage in conduct.

original: sems can thams cad stong pa nyid du rtogs pa dang / chos stong pa nyid dang / phung po lnga stong pa nyid du rtogs shing phyir mi nur ba dang / mi 'bying ba dang / mi rgod pa stong pa nyid du yang dag pa'i mtshan nyid la thabs mkhas pas bsgom par bya ba dang /
analyzed: sems can thams cad stong pa nyid du rtogs pa dang / chos stong pa nyid dang / phung po lnga stong pa nyid du rtogs shing phyir mi nur ba dang / mi 'bying ba dang / mi rgod pa stong pa nyid du yang dag pa'i mtshan nyid la thabs mkhas pas bsgom par bya ba dang /
translated: They cultivate the realization of all phenomena as emptiness, the realization of the emptiness of the five aggregates, and the correct characteristics of emptiness without backsliding, sinking, or agitation, with skill in means.

original: theg pa gsum mi spong zhing chub par slob pa'i thabs la mkhas pas shin tu zab mo'i spyod yul dam pa spyad pa la thabs mkhas bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: theg pa gsum mi spong zhing chub par slob pa'i thabs la mkhas pas shin tu zab mo'i spyod yul dam pa spyad pa la thabs mkhas bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to be skilled in the means to practice the holy domain of the extremely profound while not abandoning the three vehicles and being skilled in the means to train in them,

original: chos kyi mtshan nyid la shin tu gsal bar rtogs te /
analyzed: chos kyi mtshan nyid la shin tu gsal bar rtogs te /
translated: they clearly realize the characteristics of phenomena.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams thog ma dang / @152b tha ma'i bar du gcig ma yin par rtogs shing chud kyang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams thog ma dang / @152b tha ma'i bar du gcig ma yin par rtogs shing chud kyang /
translated: They realize that the qualities of the buddhas are not one from the beginning to the end,

original: so so'i skye bo dag ni myos shing bslad pas /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo dag ni myos shing bslad pas /
translated: but ordinary beings are deluded and confused.

original: gdung ba gsum gyis yongs su gdungs te /
analyzed: gdung ba gsum gyis yongs su gdungs te /
translated: They are tormented by the three torments

original: sdug bsngal gyi rgya mtshor nub par gyur to //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi rgya mtshor nub par gyur to //
translated: and sink into the ocean of suffering.

original: phyin ci log bzhis bsgribs pas zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos la phyin ci log tu gyur to //
analyzed: phyin ci log bzhis bsgribs pas zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos la phyin ci log tu gyur to //
translated: Obscured by the four errors, they have misconceptions about contaminated phenomena.

original: mi bden par kun tu rtog pas bdag med pa la bdag tu lta /
analyzed: mi bden par kun tu rtog pas bdag med pa la bdag tu lta /
translated: With false imagination, they view the selfless as having a self,

original: mi rtag pa la rtag par lta /
analyzed: mi rtag pa la rtag par lta /
translated: the impermanent as permanent,

original: mi bde ba la bde bar lta /
analyzed: mi bde ba la bde bar lta /
translated: the painful as pleasant,

original: mi gtsang ba la gtsang bar lta zhing /
analyzed: mi gtsang ba la gtsang bar lta zhing /
translated: and the impure as pure.

original: skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi bas gzir te /
analyzed: skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi bas gzir te /
translated: They are oppressed by birth, old age, sickness, and death.

original: skad cig tu mi rtag pas sgrib pa lnga dang; kun nas glag pa bcus kun tu glags te /
analyzed: skad cig tu mi rtag pas sgrib pa lnga dang; kun nas glag pa bcus kun tu glags te /
translated: In an instant, impermanence obscures them, and the ten entanglements entangle them.

original: srid pa gsum du 'khor zhing skye shi thog ma dang / tha ma med pa myong bar gyur to //
analyzed: srid pa gsum du 'khor zhing skye shi thog ma dang / tha ma med pa myong bar gyur to //
translated: They circle through the three realms of existence, experiencing birth and death without beginning or end.

original: de bas na de bzhin gshegs pas ci dang / cir 'phrod pa bzhin sde snod gsum dang / mdo sde dgu nas mdo sde bcu gnyis kyi bar du rnam par phye zhing bstan to //
analyzed: de bas na de bzhin gshegs pas ci dang / cir 'phrod pa bzhin sde snod gsum dang / mdo sde dgu nas mdo sde bcu gnyis kyi bar du rnam par phye zhing bstan to //
translated: Therefore, the Tathāgata, in accordance with what is appropriate, has distinguished and taught the three baskets and from the nine sūtras up to the twelve sūtras.

original: so so'i 'dod pa bzhin mdo sde mang po gsungs so //🔽tshig la chags pa kha cig bdag ni 'di kho nas chog ste /
analyzed: so so'i 'dod pa bzhin mdo sde mang po gsungs so // tshig la chags pa kha cig bdag ni 'di kho nas chog ste /
translated: He has spoken many sūtras in accordance with individual desires.🔽Some who are attached to words think, “This alone is sufficient for me.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa thob ces 'dzin pa yang yod do //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa thob ces 'dzin pa yang yod do //
translated: I will attain nirvāṇa.”

original: de yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i sngon gyi thugs rje chen po'i smon lam gyi shugs kyis phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams na las mthun pa thams cad bsdus so //
analyzed: de yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i sngon gyi thugs rje chen po'i smon lam gyi shugs kyis phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams na las mthun pa thams cad bsdus so //
translated: Moreover, by the power of the Tathāgata’s previous great compassionate aspirations, all those with concordant karma in the worlds of the ten directions are gathered.

original: de ltar las mthun pa kun 'dus pa 'khor mang po'i dkyil 'khor 'dir dam pa'i chos mdo sde gsungs @153a *//🔽par dgongs te /
analyzed: de ltar las mthun pa kun 'dus pa 'khor mang po'i dkyil 'khor 'dir dam pa'i chos mdo sde gsungs @153a *// par dgongs te /
translated: In this way, the Tathāgata, in the midst of this assembly of many retinues, intends to expound the true Dharma of the sūtras.

original: gzugs brnyan gyi chos nam du yang rgyun mi 'chad cing /
analyzed: gzugs brnyan gyi chos nam du yang rgyun mi 'chad cing /
translated: The Dharma of reflections is never interrupted,

original: so so'i skye bo thams cad bde ba chen po thob par mdzad do //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo thams cad bde ba chen po thob par mdzad do //
translated: and all ordinary beings attain great bliss.

original: de bas na de bzhin gshegs pa 'dul zhing ston pa yang dus las mi yol bar gshegs /
analyzed: de bas na de bzhin gshegs pa 'dul zhing ston pa yang dus las mi yol bar gshegs /
translated: Therefore, the Tathāgata's taming and teaching never go beyond the proper time,

original: dus las mi yol bar mya ngan las 'da'o //
analyzed: dus las mi yol bar mya ngan las 'da'o //
translated: and he never goes beyond the proper time in passing into nirvāṇa.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams kha cig tu de bzhin gshegs pa rnam par snang mdzad ces bya ba /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams kha cig tu de bzhin gshegs pa rnam par snang mdzad ces bya ba /
translated: In some world systems, the Tathāgata is known as Vairocana,

original: dgra bcom pa /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa /
translated: the Arhat,

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas /
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas /
translated: the Perfectly Enlightened One,

original: rig pa dang / zhabs su ldan pa /
analyzed: rig pa dang / zhabs su ldan pa /
translated: the One with Knowledge and Conduct,

original: bde bar gshegs pa /
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa /
translated: the Well-Gone One,

original: 'jig rten mkhyen pa /🔽skyes bu 'dul ba'i kha lo sgyur ba /
analyzed: 'jig rten mkhyen pa / skyes bu 'dul ba'i kha lo sgyur ba /
translated: the Knower of the World,

original: bla na med pa /
analyzed: bla na med pa /
translated: the Unsurpassed One,

original: ston pa rgyal ba /
analyzed: ston pa rgyal ba /
translated: the Tamer of Men,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das zhes grags so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das zhes grags so //
translated: the Teacher, the Buddha, the Blessed One.

original: skabs kha cig tu ni dga' ldan gnas su gshegs nas lha rnams kyi ston pa mdzad do //
analyzed: skabs kha cig tu ni dga' ldan gnas su gshegs nas lha rnams kyi ston pa mdzad do //
translated: In some cases, he goes to the Tuṣita Heaven and becomes the teacher of the gods.

original: skabs kha cig tu ni dga' ldan gnas nas babs te /
analyzed: skabs kha cig tu ni dga' ldan gnas nas babs te /
translated: In some cases, he descends from the Tuṣita Heaven

original: 'dzam bu'i gling du sku tshe lo brgyad cur bzhugs par yang ston to //
analyzed: 'dzam bu'i gling du sku tshe lo brgyad cur bzhugs par yang ston to //
translated: and shows himself living in Jambudvīpa for eighty years.

original: de bas na de bzhin gshegs pa ni bsam gyis mi khyab bo //
analyzed: de bas na de bzhin gshegs pa ni bsam gyis mi khyab bo //
translated: Therefore, the Tathāgata is inconceivable.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams kyang bsam gyis mi khyab bo //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams kyang bsam gyis mi khyab bo //
translated: The world is also inconceivable.

original: las kyi rnam par smin pa yang bsam gyis mi khyab bo //
analyzed: las kyi rnam par smin pa yang bsam gyis mi khyab bo //
translated: The ripening of karma is also inconceivable.

original: sems can gyi bsam pa yang bsam gyis mi khyab bo /
analyzed: sems can gyi bsam pa yang bsam gyis mi khyab bo /
translated: The thoughts of sentient beings are also inconceivable.

original: bsam gtan gyi ting nge 'dzin yang bsam gyis mi khyab bo //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi ting nge 'dzin yang bsam gyis mi khyab bo //
translated: The samādhi of meditation is also inconceivable.

original: klu'i mthu yang bsam gyis mi khyab bo //
analyzed: klu'i mthu yang bsam gyis mi khyab bo //
translated: The power of the nāgas is also inconceivable.

original: 'di ni sangs rgyas bsam gyis mi khyab pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni sangs rgyas bsam gyis mi khyab pa ste /
translated: This is the inconceivability of the Buddha.

original: sems can thams cad @153b kyis sangs rgyas kyi thugs la dgongs pa shes par 'dod na /
analyzed: sems can thams cad @153b kyis sangs rgyas kyi thugs la dgongs pa shes par 'dod na /
translated: If all sentient beings wish to know the thoughts in the Buddha's mind,

original: sems can dbang po zhan pa tha ma'i bar du yang kun shes par mdzad do //
analyzed: sems can dbang po zhan pa tha ma'i bar du yang kun shes par mdzad do //
translated: He causes even the dullest of beings to understand.

original: sems can thams cad las gang yang sangs rgyas mthong bar 'dod na /
analyzed: sems can thams cad las gang yang sangs rgyas mthong bar 'dod na /
translated: If any being wishes to see the Buddha,

original: de ma thag tu mthong bar mdzad do //
analyzed: de ma thag tu mthong bar mdzad do //
translated: he immediately sees him.

original: gal te mthong bar mi mdzad na /
analyzed: gal te mthong bar mi mdzad na /
translated: If he does not wish to see him,

original: mig sngar bab kyang mi mthong ngo //🔽de bas na nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dag lha'i mig gi mngon par shes pa yod kyang mthong bar mi nus so //
analyzed: mig sngar bab kyang mi mthong ngo // de bas na nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dag lha'i mig gi mngon par shes pa yod kyang mthong bar mi nus so //
translated: even if he is right in front of him, he does not see him.

original: de ma yin pa /
analyzed: de ma yin pa /
translated: Thus, even though the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas have the supernormal knowledge of the divine eye, they are unable to see him.

original: gzhan yang / sangs rgyas kyis 'od zer chen po bskyed nas /🔽srid pa'i rtse mo man chad mtshams med pa'i sems can dmyal ba yan chad snang bar mdzad kyang gang 'dul ba'i skal ba dang ldan pas ni mthong bar 'gyur /
analyzed: gzhan yang / sangs rgyas kyis 'od zer chen po bskyed nas / srid pa'i rtse mo man chad mtshams med pa'i sems can dmyal ba yan chad snang bar mdzad kyang gang 'dul ba'i skal ba dang ldan pas ni mthong bar 'gyur /
translated: Moreover, the Buddha emits a great light🔽that illuminates the peak of existence down to the Avīci hell. Those who are ready to be converted see it,

original: gang skal ba dang mi ldan pas ni mig sngar bab kyang mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: gang skal ba dang mi ldan pas ni mig sngar bab kyang mi mthong ngo //
translated: but those who are not ready do not see it, even if it is right in front of them.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa skabs kha cig tu ni ched du skul ba mdzad /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa skabs kha cig tu ni ched du skul ba mdzad /
translated: The Tathagata sometimes gives specific instructions.

original: skabs cig tu ni cang mi gsung bas na /
analyzed: skabs cig tu ni cang mi gsung bas na /
translated: The Tathāgata sometimes gives instructions and sometimes remains silent.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ni bsam gyis mi khyab ste /🔽shin tu dpag par dka' ba /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ni bsam gyis mi khyab ste / shin tu dpag par dka' ba /
translated: The Bhagavān Buddha is inconceivable.🔽He is extremely difficult to fathom.

original: shin tu shes shing rtogs par dka' na /
analyzed: shin tu shes shing rtogs par dka' na /
translated: He is extremely difficult to understand and realize.

original: ji ltar khyod kyis de bzhin gshegs pa la spyod pa dka' ba shin tu zab mo dri ba spobs par gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar khyod kyis de bzhin gshegs pa la spyod pa dka' ba shin tu zab mo dri ba spobs par gyur /
translated: How can you, with such eloquence, ask the Tathāgata about such a profound and difficult practice?

original: khyod kyis zhus pa 'di ni yang dag par sems can thams cad la byams shing snying brtse ba yin te /
analyzed: khyod kyis zhus pa 'di ni yang dag par sems can thams cad la byams shing snying brtse ba yin te /
translated: Your question is truly loving and compassionate toward all beings.

original: ngan 'gro gsum gyi lam bkag nas /
analyzed: ngan 'gro gsum gyi lam bkag nas /
translated: It blocks the paths to the three lower realms

original: lha dang / mi'i lam btod pa yin no //
analyzed: lha dang / mi'i lam btod pa yin no //
translated: and opens the paths to gods and humans.

original: kun dga' bo /
analyzed: kun dga' bo /
translated: Ānanda,

original: @154a *// ngas da khyod la pha ma la sri zhu bya ba'i spyad dka' ba mdo tsam zhig bstan par bya yi /
analyzed: @154a *// ngas da khyod la pha ma la sri zhu bya ba'i spyad dka' ba mdo tsam zhig bstan par bya yi /
translated: I will now teach you a brief summary of the difficult practice of serving one’s parents.

original: legs par nyon la yid la zungs shig /
analyzed: legs par nyon la yid la zungs shig /
translated: Listen well and keep it in mind.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis kun dga' bo dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams dang / 'khor mang po rnams la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis kun dga' bo dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams dang / 'khor mang po rnams la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: Then the World-Honored One said to Ananda, the bodhisattvas, and the great assembly,

original: sngon byung ba bskal ba tshad med pa mtha' yas grangs med pa 'das pa'i pha rol na /
analyzed: sngon byung ba bskal ba tshad med pa mtha' yas grangs med pa 'das pa'i pha rol na /
translated: “Long ago, innumerable, unlimited, inconceivable, immeasurable, asaṃkhyeyas of eons ago,

original: yul w'a ra n'a sir sangs rgyas rnam par gzigs zhes bya ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa /
analyzed: yul w'a ra n'a sir sangs rgyas rnam par gzigs zhes bya ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa /
translated: in the land of Varanasi, there was a buddha named Vipashyin Tathagata,

original: dgra bcom pa /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa /
translated: Arhat,

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas /
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas /
translated: Perfectly Enlightened,

original: rig pa dang / zhabs su ldan pa /
analyzed: rig pa dang / zhabs su ldan pa /
translated: Perfect in Knowledge and Conduct,

original: bde bar gshegs pa /
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa /
translated: Well-Gone,

original: 'jig rten mkhyen pa /🔽skyes bu 'dul ba'i kha lo sgyur ba /
analyzed: 'jig rten mkhyen pa / skyes bu 'dul ba'i kha lo sgyur ba /
translated: Knower of the Secular World,

original: bla na med pa /🔽ston pa rgyal ba /🔽'jig rten gyi gtso bo /
analyzed: bla na med pa / ston pa rgyal ba / 'jig rten gyi gtso bo /
translated: Unsurpassed Person,🔽Tamer of Men,🔽Teacher of Gods and Men,

original: lha dang / mi'i ston pa 'jig rten du byung ngo //
analyzed: lha dang / mi'i ston pa 'jig rten du byung ngo //
translated: World-Honored Buddha.

original: sangs rgyas de'i sku tshe'i tshad kyang bskal pa chung ngu nyi shur bzhugs so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas de'i sku tshe'i tshad kyang bskal pa chung ngu nyi shur bzhugs so //
translated: The lifespan of this buddha was twenty small eons.

original: dam pa'i chos kyang bskal pa chung ngu nyi shur gnas so //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos kyang bskal pa chung ngu nyi shur gnas so //
translated: The true Dharma will remain for twenty small eons.

original: gzugs brnyan gyi chos kyang bskal pa chung ngu nyi shur gnas so //
analyzed: gzugs brnyan gyi chos kyang bskal pa chung ngu nyi shur gnas so //
translated: The semblance Dharma will remain for twenty small eons.

original: gzugs brnyan gyi chos la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: gzugs brnyan gyi chos la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: When the semblance Dharma is practiced,

original: mi'i rgyal po r'a dza zhes bya ba 'jig rten du byung ste /
analyzed: mi'i rgyal po r'a dza zhes bya ba 'jig rten du byung ste /
translated: a human king called Rājan will appear in the world.

original: yul w'a ra n'a si la dbang sgyur ro //
analyzed: yul w'a ra n'a si la dbang sgyur ro //
translated: He will rule the land of Vārāṇasī.

original: rgyal po de la btsun mo ni nyi khri yod /
analyzed: rgyal po de la btsun mo ni nyi khri yod /
translated: This king will have twenty thousand queens,

original: blon po ni bzhi stong snyed yod do //
analyzed: blon po ni bzhi stong snyed yod do //
translated: and he will have four thousand ministers.

original: bal gyi glang po che yang lnga brgya yod /
analyzed: bal gyi glang po che yang lnga brgya yod /
translated: He will have five hundred Bactrian camels.

original: rgyal @154b phran drug cu la dbang /
analyzed: rgyal @154b phran drug cu la dbang /
translated: He will rule over sixty vassal states,

original: grong khyer brgyad brgya zhig yod /
analyzed: grong khyer brgyad brgya zhig yod /
translated: and he will have eight hundred cities.

original: rgyal po de la bu gsum yod de /
analyzed: rgyal po de la bu gsum yod de /
translated: This king will have three sons,

original: gsum char yang rgyal phran re re byed do //
analyzed: gsum char yang rgyal phran re re byed do //
translated: and each of the three will rule over a vassal state.

original: de'i tshe de'i dus na yul w'a ra n'a si'i rgyal po de mkhas shing shes rab dang ldan te /
analyzed: de'i tshe de'i dus na yul w'a ra n'a si'i rgyal po de mkhas shing shes rab dang ldan te /
translated: At that time, the king of Vārāṇasī will be wise and discerning.

original: rtag tu yang drang ba'i chos kyis yul gyi srid 'dzin pas /
analyzed: rtag tu yang drang ba'i chos kyis yul gyi srid 'dzin pas /
translated: He will always rule the country with upright Dharma.

original: gang yang gtams las chad ces bya ba med do //
analyzed: gang yang gtams las chad ces bya ba med do //
translated: There is no such thing as a man who is not born from a womb.

original: rgyal po'i bsod nams dang / yon tan gyi mthus char chu dus las mi yol te /
analyzed: rgyal po'i bsod nams dang / yon tan gyi mthus char chu dus las mi yol te /
translated: By the power of the king’s merit and virtue, rain fell in season,

original: lo tog rgyun du legs pas de na gnas pa'i mi rnams kyang bde skyid do //
analyzed: lo tog rgyun du legs pas de na gnas pa'i mi rnams kyang bde skyid do //
translated: and the people who lived there were happy and prosperous.

original: de'i tshe na w'a ra n'a si'i rgyal po de la blon po nag po sgra gcan zhes bya ba zhig yod do //
analyzed: de'i tshe na w'a ra n'a si'i rgyal po de la blon po nag po sgra gcan zhes bya ba zhig yod do //
translated: At that time, the king of Vārāṇasī had a minister named Kṛṣṇa Rāhula.

original: blon po sgra gcan rgyal po la 'khus nas /
analyzed: blon po sgra gcan rgyal po la 'khus nas /
translated: The minister Rāhula betrayed the king.🔽He arrayed the four divisions of his army🔽and attacked the king.

original: dmag rnam bzhi bshams pa la /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: dmag rnam bzhi bshams pa la / 'di lta ste /
translated: The four divisions of the army were

original: ban glang gi tshogs dang / shing rta'i tshogs dang / rta'i tshogs dang / dpung bu chung gi tshogs bshams nas /
analyzed: ban glang gi tshogs dang / shing rta'i tshogs dang / rta'i tshogs dang / dpung bu chung gi tshogs bshams nas /
translated: an army of elephants, an army of chariots, an army of cavalry, and an army of infantry.

original: w'a ra n'a si'i rgyal po la brgal nas rgyal po'i srog bcad do //
analyzed: w'a ra n'a si'i rgyal po la brgal nas rgyal po'i srog bcad do //
translated: He attacked the king of Vārāṇasī and took the king’s life.

original: de ltar rgyal po bsad nas kyang dmag gi tshogs rnam pa bzhi bkye nas /
analyzed: de ltar rgyal po bsad nas kyang dmag gi tshogs rnam pa bzhi bkye nas /
translated: Having killed the king in this way, he arrayed the four divisions of the army

original: mtha'i rgyal phran rgyal bu rab kyang bsad do //
analyzed: mtha'i rgyal phran rgyal bu rab kyang bsad do //
translated: and killed the king’s son, the prince of the neighboring vassal state.

original: de nas rgyal bu 'bring po yang phab nas /
analyzed: de nas rgyal bu 'bring po yang phab nas /
translated: Then he deposed the king’s second son🔽and made him his own vassal.

original: mtha'i rgyal phran rgyal bu tha chung gi thog tu dmag drang bar bshams so //
analyzed: mtha'i rgyal phran rgyal bu tha chung gi thog tu dmag drang bar bshams so //
translated: He prepared to lead an army against the small border kingdom.

original: rgyal bu tha chung de ngo mtshar du gzugs byad bzang la 'phags par mdzes shing rang bzhin gyis dge ba /
analyzed: rgyal bu tha chung de ngo mtshar du gzugs byad bzang la 'phags par mdzes shing rang bzhin gyis dge ba /

original: dul ba / 'dzum zhing smra ba /
analyzed: dul ba / 'dzum zhing smra ba /
translated: disciplined, smiling, and pleasant to speak to.

original: smra'o cog kyang phan pa'i don tu smra zhing @155a *//
analyzed: smra'o cog kyang phan pa'i don tu smra zhing @155a *//
translated: Whatever he said was for the benefit of others.

original: 'gyur gyi gnod pa med pa /
analyzed: 'gyur gyi gnod pa med pa /
translated: He was not deceitful,

original: rtag tu drang po'i chos kyis yul gyi srid 'dzin te /
analyzed: rtag tu drang po'i chos kyis yul gyi srid 'dzin te /
translated: and he always ruled the country with the Dharma of honesty.

original: log pas mi 'tsho bas yul mi rnams kyang bde skyid la dar ba /
analyzed: log pas mi 'tsho bas yul mi rnams kyang bde skyid la dar ba /

analyzed: longs spyod dang nor ni rin po cher ldan pa /
translated: They had wealth and possessions of great value.

original: bang mdzod gang ba /
analyzed: bang mdzod gang ba /

original: rgyal po de'i yon tan la kun gyis bsngags shing bstod pa /
analyzed: rgyal po de'i yon tan la kun gyis bsngags shing bstod pa /
translated: Everyone praised and extolled the qualities of that king.

original: bar snang gi lha dang / 'jig rten gyi lha thams cad kyis kyang dga' zhing bkur ba /
analyzed: bar snang gi lha dang / 'jig rten gyi lha thams cad kyis kyang dga' zhing bkur ba /
translated: Even the gods of the sky and all the worldly gods were pleased and honored him.

original: de'i tshe na rgyal po de la rgyal bu su sha de ba zhes bya ba gcig pu zhig yod de /
analyzed: de'i tshe na rgyal po de la rgyal bu su sha de ba zhes bya ba gcig pu zhig yod de /

original: shin tu yid gzhungs shing gsal ba /
analyzed: shin tu yid gzhungs shing gsal ba /

original: byams pa'i sems dang ldan pa; sbyin pa la dga' ba /
analyzed: byams pa'i sems dang ldan pa; sbyin pa la dga' ba /
translated: He was kind-hearted and loved to give.

original: lus kyi mdog gser du 'dug pa /
analyzed: lus kyi mdog gser du 'dug pa /
translated: His body was the color of gold.

original: gnas bdun mnyam par gang ba /
analyzed: gnas bdun mnyam par gang ba /
translated: He was endowed with the seven parts of the body that are well-proportioned.

original: skyes bu'i mtshan rdzogs par ldan pa /
analyzed: skyes bu'i mtshan rdzogs par ldan pa /
translated: He was endowed with the complete characteristics of a man.

original: lo bdun lon pa zhig yod pa de la yab rgyal po yang shin tu byams shing sdug par sems so //
analyzed: lo bdun lon pa zhig yod pa de la yab rgyal po yang shin tu byams shing sdug par sems so //
translated: He was seven years old. His father, the king, loved him very much and thought of him as dear.

original: de'i tshe na pho brang srung ba'i lha zhig rgyal po de la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de'i tshe na pho brang srung ba'i lha zhig rgyal po de la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: At that time a guardian deity of the palace said to the king,

original: rgyal po / mkhyen tam /
analyzed: rgyal po / mkhyen tam /
translated: “O King, do you know?

original: blon po sgra gcan 'khus nas yul srid phrogs te /
analyzed: blon po sgra gcan 'khus nas yul srid phrogs te /
translated: The minister Rāhula has seized the kingdom.

original: rgyal po yab kyang dkrongs /
analyzed: rgyal po yab kyang dkrongs /
translated: He has killed the king, your father.

original: dmag gi tshogs bzhi yang bkye nas /
analyzed: dmag gi tshogs bzhi yang bkye nas /
translated: He has sent out the four divisions of the army.

original: rgyal po gcen gnyis kyang srog gi dbang po dang phral te /
analyzed: rgyal po gcen gnyis kyang srog gi dbang po dang phral te /
translated: He has taken the lives of the two elder brothers.

original: dmag gi tshogs rnams ring po mi thogs par 'dir phyin na /
analyzed: dmag gi tshogs rnams ring po mi thogs par 'dir phyin na /
translated: If the army does not arrive here soon,

original: rgyal po ci'i phyir srog bskyabs shing gud du mi 'gro /
analyzed: rgyal po ci'i phyir srog bskyabs shing gud du mi 'gro /
translated: why does the king not save his life and flee?”

original: de'i tshe na rgyal po des de skad ces smras pa thos nas /
analyzed: de'i tshe na rgyal po des de skad ces smras pa thos nas /
translated: When the king heard these words,

original: lus kyi @155b ba spu kun zing zhes byed de /
analyzed: lus kyi @155b ba spu kun zing zhes byed de /
translated: the hairs on his body stood on end.

original: lus kyang 'dar nas yi mug cing mya ngan gyis sems gdungs te /
analyzed: lus kyang 'dar nas yi mug cing mya ngan gyis sems gdungs te /
translated: His body trembled, and he was overcome with grief and sorrow.

original: sa la 'gre zhing brgyal bar gyur nas ring zhig lon pa dang cung zad sangs te /
analyzed: sa la 'gre zhing brgyal bar gyur nas ring zhig lon pa dang cung zad sangs te /
translated: He rolled on the ground, fainted, and after a long time he regained consciousness.

original: dal gyis nam mkha'i lha la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: dal gyis nam mkha'i lha la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: He slowly said to the god in the sky,

original: 'di ltar smra ba'i skad ni yod la gzugs ni mi snang ba khyod ci yin /
analyzed: 'di ltar smra ba'i skad ni yod la gzugs ni mi snang ba khyod ci yin /
translated: “What are you? Your voice exists, but your form is invisible.

original: smras pa'i tshig 'di yang dag par bden nam /
analyzed: smras pa'i tshig 'di yang dag par bden nam /
translated: Are the words you spoke true?”

original: lhas smras pa /
analyzed: lhas smras pa /
translated: The god said,

original: bdag ni rgyal po'i pho brang srung ba'i lha yin te /
analyzed: bdag ni rgyal po'i pho brang srung ba'i lha yin te /
translated: “I am the god who protects the king’s palace.

original: rgyal po khyod shes pa dang ldan zhing bsod nams dang yon tan bcas pas drang po'i chos kyi yul srid 'dzin te /
analyzed: rgyal po khyod shes pa dang ldan zhing bsod nams dang yon tan bcas pas drang po'i chos kyi yul srid 'dzin te /
translated: King, you are wise and possess merit and good qualities. You rule the country with the Dharma of honesty.

original: de bas na bdag gis sngar smras pa yin te /
analyzed: de bas na bdag gis sngar smras pa yin te /
translated: That is why I spoke to you earlier.

original: sdug bsngal gyis nyon mongs par ma gyur par myur du byol zhing 'gro ba'i rigs so //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyis nyon mongs par ma gyur par myur du byol zhing 'gro ba'i rigs so //
translated: It is proper to quickly leave and go to a place where you are not afflicted by suffering.

original: de nas rgyal po de pho brang du zhugs nas /
analyzed: de nas rgyal po de pho brang du zhugs nas /
translated: Then the king entered the palace.

original: da ni bdag yul gzhan zhig tu 'gro dgos so snyam du bsams so //
analyzed: da ni bdag yul gzhan zhig tu 'gro dgos so snyam du bsams so //
translated: He thought, “Now I must go to another country.”

original: yang 'di snyam du bsams so //
analyzed: yang 'di snyam du bsams so //
translated: He thought this and then thought,

original: yul pha rol tu 'gro ba'i lam gnyis yod do //
analyzed: yul pha rol tu 'gro ba'i lam gnyis yod do //
translated: “There are two routes to the other country.

original: lam nye bar zhugs na ni zhag bdun gyis pha rol tu phyin par 'gyur /
analyzed: lam nye bar zhugs na ni zhag bdun gyis pha rol tu phyin par 'gyur /

original: lam ring por zhugs na ni zhag bcu bzhis phyin par 'gyur bas /
analyzed: lam ring por zhugs na ni zhag bcu bzhis phyin par 'gyur bas /
translated: If I take the long route, I will arrive in fourteen days.

original: ci nas lam nye bar 'gro'o snyam bsams nas /🔽zhag bdun gyi rgyags dang chas te pho brang gi phyi rol tu phyin pa dang / phyir pho brang gi nang du log nas /
analyzed: ci nas lam nye bar 'gro'o snyam bsams nas / zhag bdun gyi rgyags dang chas te pho brang gi phyi rol tu phyin pa dang / phyir pho brang gi nang du log nas /
translated: I will take the short route.”🔽He prepared provisions for seven days and went outside the palace.

original: rgyal bu su sha de ba pang du blangs te /
analyzed: rgyal bu su sha de ba pang du blangs te /
translated: He returned to the inside of the palace and took Prince Suśaṃbhava on his lap.

original: mig mi 'dzum par lta zhing dngangs pa ltar langs nas phyir yang 'dug go /
analyzed: mig mi 'dzum par lta zhing dngangs pa ltar langs nas phyir yang 'dug go /
translated: He stood there looking at him with unblinking eyes as if he were frightened.

original: de'i tshe na @156a *//
analyzed: de'i tshe na @156a *//
translated: At that time,

original: btsun mos de ltar mi bde zhing skrag pa ltar gyur pa mthong nas /
analyzed: btsun mos de ltar mi bde zhing skrag pa ltar gyur pa mthong nas /
translated: The queen saw that he was unhappy and frightened.

original: rgyal po la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: rgyal po la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: She said to the king:

original: rgyal po chen po /
analyzed: rgyal po chen po /
translated: “Great king,

original: ci'i slad du 'jigs shing skrag pa lta bu'i gzugs ston cing sku la yang rdul gyis gos pa lta bu skra yang 'dzings te /
analyzed: ci'i slad du 'jigs shing skrag pa lta bu'i gzugs ston cing sku la yang rdul gyis gos pa lta bu skra yang 'dzings te /
translated: why do you show a form that is frightened and terrified? Your body is covered with dust as if it were dirt. Your hair is matted.

original: dbugs kyang mi bde ste yul stor la thug pa'am /
analyzed: dbugs kyang mi bde ste yul stor la thug pa'am /
translated: Your breathing is labored. It is as if you have lost your country,

original: mdza' sdug pa dang bye ba'am /
analyzed: mdza' sdug pa dang bye ba'am /
translated: or as if you have been separated from your loved ones,

original: dgra sdang ba dang phrad pa lta bu dang / bkra mi shis pa'i mtshan ma dag gda' ba 'di ci lags bstan du gsol /
analyzed: dgra sdang ba dang phrad pa lta bu dang / bkra mi shis pa'i mtshan ma dag gda' ba 'di ci lags bstan du gsol /
translated: or as if you have met with an enemy. What is the meaning of these inauspicious signs? Please explain them.”

original: rgyal po smras pa /
analyzed: rgyal po smras pa /
translated: The king said,

original: kho bo ci nyes pa khyod kyis shes pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: kho bo ci nyes pa khyod kyis shes pa ma yin gyi /
translated: “You do not know what is wrong with me.

original: ma smra zhig /
analyzed: ma smra zhig /
translated: Do not speak!”

original: btsun mos gsol ba /
analyzed: btsun mos gsol ba /
translated: The queen said,

original: bdag dang / rgyal por lus gzugs gnyis kyang sems gcig ste /
analyzed: bdag dang / rgyal por lus gzugs gnyis kyang sems gcig ste /
translated: “My body and the king’s body are two, but our minds are one.

original: dper na / bya'i 'dab ma gnyis sam /
analyzed: dper na / bya'i 'dab ma gnyis sam /
translated: For example, it is like the two wings of a bird,

original: lus kyi rkang pa gnyis sam /
analyzed: lus kyi rkang pa gnyis sam /
translated: or the two legs of a body,

original: mgo'i mig gnyis sam /
analyzed: mgo'i mig gnyis sam /
translated: or the two eyes of a head.

original: de dang 'dra na ci'i slad du bdag la gsang ste mi gsung /
analyzed: de dang 'dra na ci'i slad du bdag la gsang ste mi gsung /
translated: If that is so, why do you not tell me?

original: rgyal pos btsun mo la smras pa /
analyzed: rgyal pos btsun mo la smras pa /
translated: The king said to the queen,

original: khyod mi shes sam /
analyzed: khyod mi shes sam /
translated: “Do you not know?

original: blon po sgra gcan ngan sems skyes nas /
analyzed: blon po sgra gcan ngan sems skyes nas /
translated: The minister Rāhuvaṃśa has given rise to evil thoughts.

original: rgyal po la 'khus te /
analyzed: rgyal po la 'khus te /
translated: He has slandered the king.

original: yab rgyal po yang dkrongs te /
analyzed: yab rgyal po yang dkrongs te /
translated: He has killed his father, the king.

original: gcen rgyal bu gnyis kyi srog gi bar chad byas nas /
analyzed: gcen rgyal bu gnyis kyi srog gi bar chad byas nas /
translated: He has created obstacles to the lives of the two elder princes.

original: da lta dmag dang chas te nga la rgol du 'ongs pas kho bo yul gzhan du 'byol du 'gro zhes smras nas /
analyzed: da lta dmag dang chas te nga la rgol du 'ongs pas kho bo yul gzhan du 'byol du 'gro zhes smras nas /
translated: Now he has come to attack me with an army. I will go to another country.”

original: rgyal bu dge don bang du blangs te lam du zhugs so //
analyzed: rgyal bu dge don bang du blangs te lam du zhugs so //
translated: He took Prince Sudhana on his lap and set out on the road.

original: de nas btsun mo yang rgyal po'i phyir 'brangs te song ngo //
analyzed: de nas btsun mo yang rgyal po'i phyir 'brangs te song ngo //
translated: Then the queen followed the king and went.

original: de'i @156b tshe rgyal po mya ngan gyis non te yid 'khrugs nas /
analyzed: de'i @156b tshe rgyal po mya ngan gyis non te yid 'khrugs nas /
translated: At that time the king was overcome with grief and his mind was disturbed.

original: zhag bcu bzhi'i lam du zhugs pas lam yang nor te /
analyzed: zhag bcu bzhi'i lam du zhugs pas lam yang nor te /
translated: He entered the road that was fourteen days long, but he lost his way.

original: lam de yang bgrod dka' zhing rtsva yang rtsub pa chu tsam yang med de /
analyzed: lam de yang bgrod dka' zhing rtsva yang rtsub pa chu tsam yang med de /
translated: That road was difficult to traverse, the grass was rough, and there was not even water.

original: zhag du ma zhig song song ba las rgyags kyang chad do //
analyzed: zhag du ma zhig song song ba las rgyags kyang chad do //
translated: After many days had passed, their provisions were exhausted.

original: thog ma gsang ste rgyal po gcig pu 'gro bar byas nas /
analyzed: thog ma gsang ste rgyal po gcig pu 'gro bar byas nas /

original: zhag bdun gyi rgyags las kyang ma brdzangs pa las lam yang nor /
analyzed: zhag bdun gyi rgyags las kyang ma brdzangs pa las lam yang nor /
translated: They had not brought enough provisions for seven days, and they had lost their way.

original: mi gsum gyis kyang zos te /
analyzed: mi gsum gyis kyang zos te /
translated: Three of the men had already died of starvation.

original: zhag bcu bzhi'i lam du zhugs pas da dung lam ring zhig yod pa las /
analyzed: zhag bcu bzhi'i lam du zhugs pas da dung lam ring zhig yod pa las /
translated: They had been on the road for fourteen days and still had a long way to go.
