analyzed: rgyags kyang chad nas de'i tshe rgyal po dang btsun mos skad phyung nas ngus so //
translated: Their provisions were exhausted, and at that time the king and queen cried out and wept.

original: kyi hud / kyi hud re sdug /
analyzed: kyi hud / kyi hud re sdug /
translated: “Alas! Alas! How miserable!

original: thog ma btsas nas da tsam gyi bar du 'di 'dra ba ma myong ba da 'dir myong bar gyur te /
analyzed: thog ma btsas nas da tsam gyi bar du 'di 'dra ba ma myong ba da 'dir myong bar gyur te /
translated: From the time of our birth until now, we have never experienced such suffering as this.

original: da 'dir sdug cing phongs so zhes zer te lag pas mgo la brdabs so //
analyzed: da 'dir sdug cing phongs so zhes zer te lag pas mgo la brdabs so //
translated: Now we are suffering and destitute.” They beat their heads with their hands.

original: sa la 'gre zhing lus la rdul gyis gos nas /
analyzed: sa la 'gre zhing lus la rdul gyis gos nas /
translated: Rolling on the ground, their bodies covered with dust,

original: tshig 'di skad du smre sngags 'don to //
analyzed: tshig 'di skad du smre sngags 'don to //
translated: they lamented in these words:

original: bdag cag gis tshe snga ma la sdig pa mi dge ba'i las ci zhig byas /
analyzed: bdag cag gis tshe snga ma la sdig pa mi dge ba'i las ci zhig byas /
translated: “What evil and nonvirtuous karma did we create in our previous lives?

original: 'on te pha ma dang / dgra bcom pa bsad dam /
analyzed: 'on te pha ma dang / dgra bcom pa bsad dam /
translated: “Have I killed my father or mother, or have I killed an arhat?

original: 'on te dam pa'i chos la skur pa btab bam /
analyzed: 'on te dam pa'i chos la skur pa btab bam /
translated: “Have I maliciously drawn blood from a buddha?

original: 'on te mthun pa'i dge 'dun gyi dbyen bgyis sam /
analyzed: 'on te mthun pa'i dge 'dun gyi dbyen bgyis sam /
translated: “Have I caused a schism in the saṅgha?🔽“Have I been a butcher, a fisherman, a hunter, a pig farmer, or a poultry raiser?

original: 'on te rdon pa dang / nya pa byas sam; 'on te srang dang / pre bcos te pha rol la phrog rlom byas sam /
analyzed: 'on te rdon pa dang / nya pa byas sam; 'on te srang dang / pre bcos te pha rol la phrog rlom byas sam /
translated: “Have I been a swindler, a cheat, or a thief?

original: 'on te dge 'dun gyi nor la spyod spyod dam /
analyzed: 'on te dge 'dun gyi nor la spyod spyod dam /
translated: “Have I been a monk who has misused the saṅgha’s property?

original: ci byas na 'di 'dra ba'i sdug bsngal myong bar gyur cig gu /
analyzed: ci byas na 'di 'dra ba'i sdug bsngal myong bar gyur cig gu /
translated: What have I done to experience such suffering?”

original: @157a *// de skad smra zhing cung zad bstir ni dgras slebs na /
analyzed: @157a *// de skad smra zhing cung zad bstir ni dgras slebs na /
translated: As he was saying this, the enemy arrived.

original: srog gi bar chad nges par 'byung /
analyzed: srog gi bar chad nges par 'byung /
translated: He was certain to die.

original: lam du zhugs nas 'gror ni bkres pa dang / skom pas nyen nas srog la bab tu cha'o //
analyzed: lam du zhugs nas 'gror ni bkres pa dang / skom pas nyen nas srog la bab tu cha'o //
translated: As he was traveling on the road, he was afflicted by hunger and thirst and was on the verge of death.

original: rgyal po dang / btsun mo de lta bu'i sdug bsngal gyis nyen te skad phyung ste dus pa dang / sa la 'gyel nas brgyal bar gyur to //
analyzed: rgyal po dang / btsun mo de lta bu'i sdug bsngal gyis nyen te skad phyung ste dus pa dang / sa la 'gyel nas brgyal bar gyur to //
translated: The king and the queen were afflicted by such suffering that they cried out and fell to the ground in a faint.

original: de nas ring zhig lon pa dang sangs nas 'di snyam du /
analyzed: de nas ring zhig lon pa dang sangs nas 'di snyam du /
translated: After a long time they regained consciousness and thought,🔽“

original: gsum char lhan cig tu 'di kho nar 'chi bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: gsum char lhan cig tu 'di kho nar 'chi bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: All three of us will die here together.

original: btsun mo bsad la bdag dang / bu'i srog thar bar bya'o snyam bsams nas /
analyzed: btsun mo bsad la bdag dang / bu'i srog thar bar bya'o snyam bsams nas /
translated: I will kill the queen and save the lives of my son and myself.”

original: ral gri phyung ste btsun mo gsad par bshams pa dang / rgyal bu dge don gyis rgyal po'i lag pa nas bzung ste /
analyzed: ral gri phyung ste btsun mo gsad par bshams pa dang / rgyal bu dge don gyis rgyal po'i lag pa nas bzung ste /
translated: He drew his sword and was about to kill the queen when Prince Puṇyabala grabbed his father’s hand and said,

original: da ltar ci zhig mdzad dgongs zhes gsol to //
analyzed: da ltar ci zhig mdzad dgongs zhes gsol to //
translated: “What are you thinking of doing now?”

original: yab rgyal pos mig nas mchi mas gang bzhin du rgyal bu la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: yab rgyal pos mig nas mchi mas gang bzhin du rgyal bu la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: The king, his eyes filled with tears, said to his son,

original: khyod kyi ma btsun mo dam pa bsad la khyod kyis srog gso snyam mo //
analyzed: khyod kyi ma btsun mo dam pa bsad la khyod kyis srog gso snyam mo //
translated: “I thought I would kill your mother, the queen, and save your life.”

original: gal te ma bsad kyang rang 'chi bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te ma bsad kyang rang 'chi bar 'gyur te /
translated: “Even if you don’t kill her, she will die.

original: kho bo ni 'chi'am /
analyzed: kho bo ni 'chi'am /
translated: Whether I die

original: gson yang rung na /
analyzed: gson yang rung na /
translated: or live,

original: bu khyod kyi srog gso ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bu khyod kyi srog gso ba'i phyir /
translated: in order to save your life,

original: khyod kyi ma btsun mo dam pa bsad snyam mo //
analyzed: khyod kyi ma btsun mo dam pa bsad snyam mo //
translated: I thought I would kill your mother, the queen.”

original: de nas rgyal bu dge don gyis yab rgyal po la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas rgyal bu dge don gyis yab rgyal po la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then Prince Puṇyabala said to his father, the king,

original: gal te btsun mo bsad par gyur na /
analyzed: gal te btsun mo bsad par gyur na /
translated: “If the queen is killed,

original: de'i sha la bdag mi 'tshal te /
analyzed: de'i sha la bdag mi 'tshal te /
translated: I do not want to eat my own flesh.

original: gang na yang ma'i sha la bu za ba mi srid pas /
analyzed: gang na yang ma'i sha la bu za ba mi srid pas /
translated: It is impossible for a child to eat the flesh of its mother.

original: bdag kyang 'chi bar 'gyur @157b na; yab rgyal po ci'i slad du bdag bkum ste pha ma'i srog thar par mi mdzad /
analyzed: bdag kyang 'chi bar 'gyur @157b na; yab rgyal po ci'i slad du bdag bkum ste pha ma'i srog thar par mi mdzad /
translated: Father, King, why do you want to kill me? Why do you not save the lives of your parents?

original: yab rgyal pos de skad smras pa thos nas /
analyzed: yab rgyal pos de skad smras pa thos nas /
translated: When the king heard this,

original: mod la khams te 'gyel nas sa la 'gre zhing rgyal bu la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: mod la khams te 'gyel nas sa la 'gre zhing rgyal bu la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: he was overcome with emotion and fell to the ground. Rolling on the ground, he said to the prince:

original: khyod kho po'i mig dang 'dra na su zhig rang gi mig phyung ste za bar byed /
analyzed: khyod kho po'i mig dang 'dra na su zhig rang gi mig phyung ste za bar byed /
translated: “You are like my eyes. Who would take out his own eyes and eat them?

original: kho bo ni shi yang sla bas bu mi gsod do //
analyzed: kho bo ni shi yang sla bas bu mi gsod do //
translated: It would be easier for me to die than to kill my son.

original: bu bsad de sha za mi nus so //
analyzed: bu bsad de sha za mi nus so //
translated: I cannot kill my son and eat his flesh.”

original: de nas rgyal bu dge don gyis yang yab rgyal po la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas rgyal bu dge don gyis yang yab rgyal po la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then Prince Puṇyabala said to his father, the king:

original: gal te yab yum gyis bdag bkum na sha khrag kyang ring po mi thogs par rul sums nas dgongs pa ma mchis par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te yab yum gyis bdag bkum na sha khrag kyang ring po mi thogs par rul sums nas dgongs pa ma mchis par 'gyur te /
translated: “Father, Mother, if you kill me, my flesh and blood will soon rot and go bad.

original: bdag gi gsol pa gcig cig ma gnang na byams pa'i yab yum ma lags pas /
analyzed: bdag gi gsol pa gcig cig ma gnang na byams pa'i yab yum ma lags pas /
translated: If you do not grant me this one request, then you are not my kind father and mother.

original: bdag gi yid dang mi 'gal bar mdzad du gsol /
analyzed: bdag gi yid dang mi 'gal bar mdzad du gsol /
translated: Please do not go against my wishes.

original: de nas yab rgyal pos sras rgyal bu la khyod kyi yid dang mi 'gal bar bya bas /
analyzed: de nas yab rgyal pos sras rgyal bu la khyod kyi yid dang mi 'gal bar bya bas /
translated: Then the king, the father, said to his son, In order not to go against your wishes,

original: ci gsol ba rnams myur du smros shig ces bsgo ba dang / rgyal bu dge don gyis yab rgyal po la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: ci gsol ba rnams myur du smros shig ces bsgo ba dang / rgyal bu dge don gyis yab rgyal po la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: quickly tell me what you want.

original: yab yum gyis bdag la thugs brtse ba'i slad du nyin re zhing bdag gi lus las sha rgya ma gsum gsum bcad de /
analyzed: yab yum gyis bdag la thugs brtse ba'i slad du nyin re zhing bdag gi lus las sha rgya ma gsum gsum bcad de /
translated: Prince Sudhana said to his father, the king, In order to show your love for me, father and mother, every day cut three pounds of flesh from my body.

original: cha gnyis ni yab yum la dbul /
analyzed: cha gnyis ni yab yum la dbul /
translated: Two parts of it I will offer to you, father and mother,

original: vcha gcig ni bdag rang 'tshal na /
analyzed: vcha gcig ni bdag rang 'tshal na /
translated: and one part I will eat myself.

original: lus srog gi zungs su 'gyur ro //🔽de nas rgyal pos kyang rgyal bus gsol ba bzhin du gnang nas /
analyzed: lus srog gi zungs su 'gyur ro // de nas rgyal pos kyang rgyal bus gsol ba bzhin du gnang nas /
translated: In this way I will be able to sustain my body and life.

original: nyin gcig bzhin sha rgya ma gsum gsum bcad de /
analyzed: nyin gcig bzhin sha rgya ma gsum gsum bcad de /
translated: Then the king granted the prince's request and said, Every day cut three pounds of flesh

original: cha gsum du bgos nas /
analyzed: cha gsum du bgos nas /
translated: and divide it into three parts.

original: @158a *// cha gnyis ni rgyal po dang / btsun mo za /
analyzed: @158a *// cha gnyis ni rgyal po dang / btsun mo za /
translated: Two parts will be for the king and queen to eat,🔽 and one part you will eat yourself.

original: cha gcig ni rgyal bu rang za ste /
analyzed: cha gcig ni rgyal bu rang za ste /
translated: The prince ate the other half.

original: lus dang srog gi zungs byas nas /
analyzed: lus dang srog gi zungs byas nas /
translated: He nourished his body and life🔽and continued on his way.

original: lam du zhugs te song song ba las zhag gnyis kyis yul pha rol ma slebs par rgyal bu'i lus kyi sha zad de /
analyzed: lam du zhugs te song song ba las zhag gnyis kyis yul pha rol ma slebs par rgyal bu'i lus kyi sha zad de /
translated: After two days, he had not yet reached the other side of the country. The prince’s flesh was exhausted.

original: rus pa'i tshigs dang / chu ba tsam zhig 'brel te /
analyzed: rus pa'i tshigs dang / chu ba tsam zhig 'brel te /
translated: Only the joints of his bones and the sinews that connected them remained.

original: srog gi lhag ma tsam zhig lus nas sa la 'gyel to //
analyzed: srog gi lhag ma tsam zhig lus nas sa la 'gyel to //
translated: Only the remainder of his life remained. He fell to the ground.

original: de nas rgyal po dang / btsun mos rgyal bu pang du blangs nas /
analyzed: de nas rgyal po dang / btsun mos rgyal bu pang du blangs nas /
translated: Then the king and queen took the prince in their arms.

original: skad chen po phyung nas cho nges chen po btab ste /
analyzed: skad chen po phyung nas cho nges chen po btab ste /
translated: They let out a great cry and wailed loudly.

original: 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: They said:

original: nged gnyis kyis ma rig pas khyod kyi sha zos te /
analyzed: nged gnyis kyis ma rig pas khyod kyi sha zos te /
translated: “We two, out of ignorance, ate your flesh.

original: khyod 'di lta bu'i na tsha'i sdug bsngal myong bar gyur la /
analyzed: khyod 'di lta bu'i na tsha'i sdug bsngal myong bar gyur la /
translated: You experienced this kind of suffering of illness.🔽The road is still long. Your flesh is exhausted.

original: lam yang da dung ring bas khyod kyis lus kyi sha ni zad de; da ni lhan cig tu gnas 'dir ro bzhag go /
analyzed: lam yang da dung ring bas khyod kyis lus kyi sha ni zad de; da ni lhan cig tu gnas 'dir ro bzhag go /
translated: Now, together, we will stay here and die.”

original: de nas rgyal bu dge don gyis skad chung dus yab rgyal po la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas rgyal bu dge don gyis skad chung dus yab rgyal po la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then Prince Sudhana spoke to his father, the king, in a small voice:

original: da ni 'di nas pha rol du zhag gcig tsam gyis lam las ma lus te /
analyzed: da ni 'di nas pha rol du zhag gcig tsam gyis lam las ma lus te /
translated: “Now, from here to the other side, the road is only one day’s journey.

original: bdag ni g-yo zhing bskyod mi nus pas srog 'dir 'dor ro //
analyzed: bdag ni g-yo zhing bskyod mi nus pas srog 'dir 'dor ro //
translated: I am unable to move or stir. I will lose my life here.

original: rgyal po dang / btsun mo ni mi ma rabs ngan pa ltar lhan cig tu gnas 'dir ro gzhag go ma gsungs shig /
analyzed: rgyal po dang / btsun mo ni mi ma rabs ngan pa ltar lhan cig tu gnas 'dir ro gzhag go ma gsungs shig /
translated: Do not say that the king and queen will leave their son’s corpse here like low-class people.

original: bdag la byams shing thugs brtse bar dgongs na bdag gis bsams pa dang mi 'gal bar mdzad du gsol /
analyzed: bdag la byams shing thugs brtse bar dgongs na bdag gis bsams pa dang mi 'gal bar mdzad du gsol /
translated: If you think of me with love and compassion, please do not go against what I have thought.

original: da dung yang bdag gis rus pa'i gseb na sha ci yod pa ma lus par gtogs la yul pha rol tu @158b gshegs su gsol /
analyzed: da dung yang bdag gis rus pa'i gseb na sha ci yod pa ma lus par gtogs la yul pha rol tu @158b gshegs su gsol /
translated: Please take what little flesh there is left in my bones and go to the other country.”

original: de nas rgyal pos yang rgyal bus gsol pa bzhin du tshigs dang / rus pa'i gseb na sha ci yod pa zad par btogs nas cha gsum du bgos te /
analyzed: de nas rgyal pos yang rgyal bus gsol pa bzhin du tshigs dang / rus pa'i gseb na sha ci yod pa zad par btogs nas cha gsum du bgos te /
translated: Then the king, as the prince had requested, took what little flesh there was left in his bones, divided it into three parts,

original: cha gnyis ni rgyal po dang / btsun mos zos /
analyzed: cha gnyis ni rgyal po dang / btsun mos zos /
translated: and the king and queen ate two parts.

original: cha gcig ni rgyal bu rang gis zos te /
analyzed: cha gcig ni rgyal bu rang gis zos te /
translated: The prince himself ate the other half.

original: rgyal po dang / btsun mo yang lam du zhugs nas dong ngo //
analyzed: rgyal po dang / btsun mo yang lam du zhugs nas dong ngo //
translated: The king and queen set out on the road and left.

original: rgyal bu dge don langs nas 'greng bzhin rgyal po dang btsun mo song ba la lta'o //
analyzed: rgyal bu dge don langs nas 'greng bzhin rgyal po dang btsun mo song ba la lta'o //
translated: Prince Sudhana stood up and watched as the king and queen left.

original: rgyal po dang / btsun mo gnyis skad chung nas ngu bzhin song nas /
analyzed: rgyal po dang / btsun mo gnyis skad chung nas ngu bzhin song nas /
translated: The king and queen went along, crying softly.

original: rgyal bu dge don gyi mig gis mi song kyi bar du rgyal po dang / btsun mo la chags pa'i sems kyis mig mi 'dzum par lta lta nas ring zhig lon pa dang / phyir sa la 'gyel to //
analyzed: rgyal bu dge don gyi mig gis mi song kyi bar du rgyal po dang / btsun mo la chags pa'i sems kyis mig mi 'dzum par lta lta nas ring zhig lon pa dang / phyir sa la 'gyel to //
translated: For a long time, with eyes that did not blink, he gazed with a mind attached to the king and queen, until they were out of sight. Then he fell to the ground.

original: sha dang / khrag gi dri bro pas phyogs bcu nas sbrang ma dang / sha sbrang mang po 'dus nas /
analyzed: sha dang / khrag gi dri bro pas phyogs bcu nas sbrang ma dang / sha sbrang mang po 'dus nas /
translated: Because of the smell of his flesh and blood, many bees and flies gathered from the ten directions.

original: rgyal bu yo ga pa tsam du lus la za zhing 'jus te /
analyzed: rgyal bu yo ga pa tsam du lus la za zhing 'jus te /
translated: They ate and stung his body until it was like a yo-ga-pa.

original: sdug bsngal gyis gdungs so //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyis gdungs so //
translated: He was tormented by suffering.

original: de'i tshe na rgyal bu de srog gi lhag ma tsam zhig ma chad de /
analyzed: de'i tshe na rgyal bu de srog gi lhag ma tsam zhig ma chad de /
translated: At that time, only a little of the prince's life remained.

original: skad phyung nas 'di skad ces smon lam du btab bo //
analyzed: skad phyung nas 'di skad ces smon lam du btab bo //
translated: He cried out and made this aspiration prayer:

original: bdag gi sngon gyi mi dge ba'i las rnams ni 'dis byang zhing zad par gyur cig /
analyzed: bdag gi sngon gyi mi dge ba'i las rnams ni 'dis byang zhing zad par gyur cig /
translated: May my past nonvirtuous karma be purified and exhausted by this.

original: deng slan chad mi bgyid do //
analyzed: deng slan chad mi bgyid do //
translated: From now on, I will not do it again.

original: bdag gi lus pha ma la phul te /
analyzed: bdag gi lus pha ma la phul te /
translated: I offer my body to my parents.

original: sbyin pa byas pas bdag gi pha ma snga ma bas lhag pa'i bsod nams bcu gcig dang ldan te /
analyzed: sbyin pa byas pas bdag gi pha ma snga ma bas lhag pa'i bsod nams bcu gcig dang ldan te /
translated: By giving this gift, may my parents come to possess eleven qualities of merit that surpass those of others.

original: bde bar nyal ba dang / bde bar sad pa dang / rmi lam ngan pa mi rmi ba dang / lhas bsrung ba dang / @159a *//
analyzed: bde bar nyal ba dang / bde bar sad pa dang / rmi lam ngan pa mi rmi ba dang / lhas bsrung ba dang / @159a *//
translated: May they sleep peacefully, wake peacefully, have no bad dreams, be protected by the gods,

original: mis bkur ba dang / zhal mchu dang / rkun po dang / dgra dang / rku lto byed pa med cing /
analyzed: mis bkur ba dang / zhal mchu dang / rkun po dang / dgra dang / rku lto byed pa med cing /
translated: be respected by humans, and be free from disputes, thieves, enemies, and robbers.

original: dus thams cad du bkra shis par shog cig /
analyzed: dus thams cad du bkra shis par shog cig /
translated: May they be auspicious at all times.

original: bdag gi lus lhag ma tsam sha khrag sbrang ma la byin pas thams cad du 'drangs shing tshim par gyur te /
analyzed: bdag gi lus lhag ma tsam sha khrag sbrang ma la byin pas thams cad du 'drangs shing tshim par gyur te /
translated: May the remainder of my body, my flesh and blood, satisfy and delight all the bees to whom I give it.

original: bdag ma 'ongs pa'i dus na sangs rgyas su grub par shog cig /
analyzed: bdag ma 'ongs pa'i dus na sangs rgyas su grub par shog cig /
translated: May I attain buddhahood in the future.

original: sangs rgyas su grub nas chos kyi sku thob nas kyang chos kyi skus thams cad kyis bkres skom pa'i mu ge dang / skye shir 'khor ba'i nad lci ba sel bar shog cig /
analyzed: sangs rgyas su grub nas chos kyi sku thob nas kyang chos kyi skus thams cad kyis bkres skom pa'i mu ge dang / skye shir 'khor ba'i nad lci ba sel bar shog cig /
translated: And after attaining Buddhahood and the Dharmakaya, may the Dharmakaya remove the famine of hunger and thirst and the heavy sickness of birth and death for all.

original: rgyal bus de skad smon lam btab pa na /
analyzed: rgyal bus de skad smon lam btab pa na /
translated: When the prince had made this vow,

original: gnam sa yang rnam pa drug tu g-yos /
analyzed: gnam sa yang rnam pa drug tu g-yos /
translated: the earth and the heavens shook in six ways.

original: nyi ma yang 'od mi gsal bar gyur /
analyzed: nyi ma yang 'od mi gsal bar gyur /
translated: The sun lost its radiance.

original: gcan gzan dang / ri dvags rnams kyang skrag nas kun tu rgyug /
analyzed: gcan gzan dang / ri dvags rnams kyang skrag nas kun tu rgyug /
translated: Wild beasts and deer ran about in terror.

original: rgya mtsho yang rab tu 'khrugs /
analyzed: rgya mtsho yang rab tu 'khrugs /
translated: The ocean was churned up.

original: ri rab kyang 'gul zhing ldeg /
analyzed: ri rab kyang 'gul zhing ldeg /
translated: Mount Meru trembled and shook.

original: sum cu rtsa gsum gnam gyi bar du yang rab tu g-yas so //
analyzed: sum cu rtsa gsum gnam gyi bar du yang rab tu g-yas so //
translated: It shook as far as the heavens of the Thirty-three.

original: de'i tshe brgya byin lha'i dbang pos 'dod pa'i khams kyi lha dag dang / 'dzam bu'i gling dag tu babs nas /
analyzed: de'i tshe brgya byin lha'i dbang pos 'dod pa'i khams kyi lha dag dang / 'dzam bu'i gling dag tu babs nas /
translated: At that time Sakra, lord of the gods, descended with the gods of the desire realm to Jambudvipa.

original: rgyal bu dge don bsdigs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rgyal bu dge don bsdigs pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to frighten Prince Sudhana,

original: seng ge dang / stag dang / 'phar sbyang las sogs pa'i lus su sprul nas mig bsgrad /
analyzed: seng ge dang / stag dang / 'phar sbyang las sogs pa'i lus su sprul nas mig bsgrad /
translated: he transformed himself into the bodies of lions, tigers, leopards, and bears, and glared at him with his eyes.

original: kha gdangs / spu bsgreng nas skad chen po'i nga ro phyung ste /
analyzed: kha gdangs / spu bsgreng nas skad chen po'i nga ro phyung ste /
translated: and with his hair standing on end, he roared out a loud cry.

original: rgyal bu la mtshong ba bzhin bsdigs so //
analyzed: rgyal bu la mtshong ba bzhin bsdigs so //
translated: He threatened the prince as if he were a merchant.

original: de'i tshe rgyal bu dge don gyis gcan gzan khro bo de dag mthong @159b nas kyang skad mi che bas 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de'i tshe rgyal bu dge don gyis gcan gzan khro bo de dag mthong @159b nas kyang skad mi che bas 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: At that time, Prince Sudhana, seeing those ferocious beasts, spoke in a small voice, saying,

original: khyed rnams kho bo za 'dod na ci bder zo zhig /
analyzed: khyed rnams kho bo za 'dod na ci bder zo zhig /
translated: If you want to eat me, then eat me as you please.

original: 'di 'dra ba'i mthu rtsal gyis bsdigs ci dgos zhes bsgo'o //
analyzed: 'di 'dra ba'i mthu rtsal gyis bsdigs ci dgos zhes bsgo'o //
translated: What need is there to threaten me with such power?

original: de nas brgya byin lha'i dbang pos smras pa /🔽bdag cag ni seng ge'am /
analyzed: de nas brgya byin lha'i dbang pos smras pa / bdag cag ni seng ge'am /
translated: Then Śakra, Lord of the Gods, said,🔽We are not lions

original: gcan gzan ma yin te /
analyzed: gcan gzan ma yin te /
translated: or beasts.

original: brgya byin lha'i dbang po yin te /
analyzed: brgya byin lha'i dbang po yin te /
translated: I am Śakra, Lord of the Gods.

original: khyod bgam zhing sad du 'ongs so //
analyzed: khyod bgam zhing sad du 'ongs so //
translated: I have come to test and examine you.

original: de'i tshe rgyal bus brgya byin lha'i dbang po mthong nas shin tu dga' mgu rangs par yang gyur to //
analyzed: de'i tshe rgyal bus brgya byin lha'i dbang po mthong nas shin tu dga' mgu rangs par yang gyur to //
translated: At that time, when the prince saw Śakra, Lord of the Gods, he became extremely happy and delighted.

original: de nas brgya byin gyis rgyal bu la smras pa /
analyzed: de nas brgya byin gyis rgyal bu la smras pa /
translated: Then Śakra said to the prince,🔽Good man, you are truly a bodhisattva.

original: khyod kyis shin tu gtong dka' ba btang ste lus kyi sha khrag gis pha ma la bstabs pa 'di'i bsod nams kyis khyod bdud kyi rgyal po 'dod dam /
analyzed: khyod kyis shin tu gtong dka' ba btang ste lus kyi sha khrag gis pha ma la bstabs pa 'di'i bsod nams kyis khyod bdud kyi rgyal po 'dod dam /
translated: You have given away what is very difficult to give, and have offered your parents the flesh and blood of your body. By the merit of that, do you wish to be king of the demons?

original: 'on te tshangs pa'i rgyal po 'dod dam /
analyzed: 'on te tshangs pa'i rgyal po 'dod dam /
translated: Or do you wish to be king of the Brahma gods?

original: lha'i dbang po'am /
analyzed: lha'i dbang po'am /
translated: Or king of the gods?

original: mi'i rgyal po'am /
analyzed: mi'i rgyal po'am /
translated: Or king of humans?

original: 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po 'dod /🔽rgyal bus smras pa /
analyzed: 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po 'dod / rgyal bus smras pa /
translated: Or a universal monarch?

original: bdag ni bdud kyi rgyal po'am /
analyzed: bdag ni bdud kyi rgyal po'am /
translated: The prince said, I do not desire to be king of the demons,🔽king of the Brahma gods,

original: tshangs pa'am / lha'i rgyal po'am /
analyzed: tshangs pa'am / lha'i rgyal po'am /
translated: king of the gods,

original: mi'i rgyal po'am /
analyzed: mi'i rgyal po'am /
translated: king of humans,

original: 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po gang yang mi 'dod de /
analyzed: 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po gang yang mi 'dod de /
translated: or a universal monarch.

original: sems can thams cad rnam par grol bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sems can thams cad rnam par grol bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: For the sake of liberating all sentient beings,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'dod do //🔽brgya byin gyis smras pa /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'dod do // brgya byin gyis smras pa /
translated: I desire unsurpassed, perfect, complete enlightenment.

original: khyod ni shin tu yang gti mug can zhig yin pa 'dra /
analyzed: khyod ni shin tu yang gti mug can zhig yin pa 'dra /
translated: Śakra said, You seem to be very confused.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ni yun ring po nas shin tu dga' pas bsgrubs pas gzod 'grub ce'o //🔽khyod kyis shin tu sdug @160a *//
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ni yun ring po nas shin tu dga' pas bsgrubs pas gzod 'grub ce'o // khyod kyis shin tu sdug @160a *//
translated: “Anuttarā samyak-saṃbodhi is accomplished after a long time through great joy.”

original: bsngal ba bzod dam /
analyzed: bsngal ba bzod dam /
translated: “Can you endure great suffering?”

original: rgyal bus smras pa /
analyzed: rgyal bus smras pa /
translated: The prince said,

original: gal te lcags kyi 'khor lo 'bar ba bdag gi spyi bo'i steng na rgyun du 'khor yang sdug bsngal de tsam gyis bdag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir mi ldog go /
analyzed: gal te lcags kyi 'khor lo 'bar ba bdag gi spyi bo'i steng na rgyun du 'khor yang sdug bsngal de tsam gyis bdag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir mi ldog go /
translated: “Even if a blazing iron wheel were to constantly turn on the top of my head, I would not turn back from unsurpassed perfect complete awakening because of suffering to that extent.”

original: brgya byin gyis smras pa /
analyzed: brgya byin gyis smras pa /
translated: Śakra said,

original: khyod kyis smras pa stong pa 'di la su zhig yid ches par 'gyur /
analyzed: khyod kyis smras pa stong pa 'di la su zhig yid ches par 'gyur /
translated: “Who would believe this empty talk of yours?”

original: de nas rgyal bus dam bcas nas smon lam 'di skad ces btab bo //
analyzed: de nas rgyal bus dam bcas nas smon lam 'di skad ces btab bo //
translated: Then the prince, having made a vow, made this aspiration:

original: gal te bdag gi smra ba'i chig rdzun te lha'i dbang po bslus par gyur na /
analyzed: gal te bdag gi smra ba'i chig rdzun te lha'i dbang po bslus par gyur na /
translated: “If what I have said is false and I have deceived the lord of the gods,

original: bdag gi lus kyi rma 'di nam du yang 'tsho bar ma gyur cig /
analyzed: bdag gi lus kyi rma 'di nam du yang 'tsho bar ma gyur cig /
translated: may this wound on my body never heal.

original: gal te smra ba'i tshig bden na bdag gi lus kyang sor chud cing khrag kyang 'o mar gyur cig ces smras ma thag tu /
analyzed: gal te smra ba'i tshig bden na bdag gi lus kyang sor chud cing khrag kyang 'o mar gyur cig ces smras ma thag tu /
translated: As soon as he said this,

original: lus kyi rma yang snga mkho bzhin sor chud de; khrag kyang 'o mar gyur nas rgyal bu'i byad gzugs kyang snga ma bas lhag par bzang zhing sdug pa dang / mdzes par gyur te /
analyzed: lus kyi rma yang snga mkho bzhin sor chud de; khrag kyang 'o mar gyur nas rgyal bu'i byad gzugs kyang snga ma bas lhag par bzang zhing sdug pa dang / mdzes par gyur te /
translated: his body’s wounds were restored to their former state, and his blood turned to milk. The prince’s appearance became even more excellent, handsome, and beautiful than before.

original: langs nas lha'i dbang po'i rkang pa la mgo bos phyag byas so //
analyzed: langs nas lha'i dbang po'i rkang pa la mgo bos phyag byas so //
translated: He stood up and bowed his head to the feet of the lord of the gods.

original: de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis rgyal bu khyod legs so //
analyzed: de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis rgyal bu khyod legs so //
translated: Then Śakra, Lord of the Gods, said to the prince, “Excellent!

original: shin tu legs so //
analyzed: shin tu legs so //
translated: Excellent!

original: shin tu dpa' ba'i brtson 'grus kyis gdon mi za bar bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shin tu dpa' ba'i brtson 'grus kyis gdon mi za bar bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Through your extremely heroic diligence, you will undoubtedly attain unsurpassed perfect awakening.

original: ring por mi thogs par bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob pa na /
analyzed: ring por mi thogs par bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob pa na /
translated: Before long, you will attain unsurpassed perfect awakening.

original: thog mar bdag gis don mdzad par gyur @160b cig ces smras nas /
analyzed: thog mar bdag gis don mdzad par gyur @160b cig ces smras nas /
translated: First, may I accomplish the benefit of beings.”

original: brgya byin lha'i dbang po yang nam mkha'i phyogs de nyid du mi snang bar gyur to //
analyzed: brgya byin lha'i dbang po yang nam mkha'i phyogs de nyid du mi snang bar gyur to //
translated: Śakra, Lord of the Gods, also disappeared into the sky.

original: de'i tshe rgyal po dang / btsun mo yang rgyal po pha rol po de'i drung du phyin nas /
analyzed: de'i tshe rgyal po dang / btsun mo yang rgyal po pha rol po de'i drung du phyin nas /
translated: At that time, the king and queen went before the other king.

original: rgyal po des kyang rgyang ma nas bsu nas /
analyzed: rgyal po des kyang rgyang ma nas bsu nas /
translated: The other king welcomed them from afar.

original: dgos pa'i yo byad yid bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: dgos pa'i yo byad yid bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: He provided all the necessary provisions to their satisfaction.

original: de'i tshe rgyal po dang / btsun mo des rgyal bus lus kyi sha khrag gis pha ma la ji ltar bstabs pa rgyal po de la zhib tu brjod pa dang / rgyal po des ji ltar brjod pa de dag thos nas /
analyzed: de'i tshe rgyal po dang / btsun mo des rgyal bus lus kyi sha khrag gis pha ma la ji ltar bstabs pa rgyal po de la zhib tu brjod pa dang / rgyal po des ji ltar brjod pa de dag thos nas /
translated: At that time, the king and queen told the other king in detail how the prince had served them with the flesh and blood of his own body, and when the king heard what they said,🔽he thought, The prince repaid his parents' great kindness by serving them with the flesh and blood of his own body.

original: rgyal bu des lus gyi sha khrag gis pha ma la bstabs pas sri zhu cher byas pa'i drin lan bsabs nas dmag rnam bzhi bshams nas /
analyzed: rgyal bu des lus gyi sha khrag gis pha ma la bstabs pas sri zhu cher byas pa'i drin lan bsabs nas dmag rnam bzhi bshams nas /
translated: Now, let me repay his kindness by leading the four divisions of my army

original: rgyal po de dang yul w'a ra n'a sir dmag drangs so //
analyzed: rgyal po de dang yul w'a ra n'a sir dmag drangs so //
translated: and attacking that king and the country of Vārāṇasī.

original: de'i tshe rgyal po de dmag rnam bzhi dang chas nas lam du zhugs te /
analyzed: de'i tshe rgyal po de dmag rnam bzhi dang chas nas lam du zhugs te /
translated: At that time, the king set out with the four divisions of his army and entered the road.

original: rgyal bu dang bral ba'i gnas su phyin pa dang; 'di snyam du bdag gi bu ni gdon mi za bar 'di nyid du shi na /
analyzed: rgyal bu dang bral ba'i gnas su phyin pa dang; 'di snyam du bdag gi bu ni gdon mi za bar 'di nyid du shi na /
translated: When he reached the place where the prince had been, he thought, “My son must have died right here.

original: bu'i rus ba tsam bsdus te phyir bdag gi yul du bkur ro snyam du bsams nas /
analyzed: bu'i rus ba tsam bsdus te phyir bdag gi yul du bkur ro snyam du bsams nas /
translated: I will gather up his bones and take them back to my country.”

original: skad phyung nas ngu zhing bu'i rus bu sdud du song song ba la /
analyzed: skad phyung nas ngu zhing bu'i rus bu sdud du song song ba la /
translated: He cried out and went to gather up his son’s bones.

original: rgyang ma nas bdag gi bu lus kyi rma yang sos nas /
analyzed: rgyang ma nas bdag gi bu lus kyi rma yang sos nas /
translated: From a distance he saw his son, his body’s wounds healed,

original: sngar bas kyang bzang zhing mdzes te drung du 'ongs so //
analyzed: sngar bas kyang bzang zhing mdzes te drung du 'ongs so //
translated: better and more handsome than before, coming toward him.

original: de nas rgyal pos pang du blangs te /
analyzed: de nas rgyal pos pang du blangs te /
translated: The king took him in his arms

original: khyod da dung gson nam zhes smras pa dang / rgyal bus ji ltar gyur pa yab rgyal po dang / btsun mo la smras so //
analyzed: khyod da dung gson nam zhes smras pa dang / rgyal bus ji ltar gyur pa yab rgyal po dang / btsun mo la smras so //
translated: and said, “Are you still alive?” The prince told what had happened to the king and queen.

original: rgyal po dang / btsun mo rab tu dga' ste /
analyzed: rgyal po dang / btsun mo rab tu dga' ste /
translated: The king and queen were overjoyed.

original: thams cad ban glang la zhon @161a *//
analyzed: thams cad ban glang la zhon @161a *//
translated: They all mounted elephants

original: nas; phyir bdag gi yul du phyin pa dang / rgyal bu de'i bsod nams kyi mthus bdag gi yul yang phyir thob nas /
analyzed: nas; phyir bdag gi yul du phyin pa dang / rgyal bu de'i bsod nams kyi mthus bdag gi yul yang phyir thob nas /
translated: and returned to their own country. By the power of the prince’s merit, they regained their own country.

original: rgyal bu don grub rgyal por dbang bskur te rgyal por bcug go /
analyzed: rgyal bu don grub rgyal por dbang bskur te rgyal por bcug go /
translated: He was enthroned as the king, and the prince was named Siddhārtha.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi kun dga' bo la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi kun dga' bo la bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavān said to Ānanda,

original: de'i tshe de'i dus na yab rgyal por gyur pa de gzhan yin snyam du khyod sems na; de de ltar mi blta'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe de'i dus na yab rgyal por gyur pa de gzhan yin snyam du khyod sems na; de de ltar mi blta'o //
translated: “If you think that the king who was the father at that time, on that occasion, was someone else, you should not regard him in that way.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de'i tshe de'i dus na yab rgyal po de ni da ltar nga'i yab zas gtsang ma zhes bya bar gyur to //🔽de'i tshe de'i dus na yum du gyur pa de ni gzhan yin pa snyam du khyod sems na /
analyzed: de'i tshe de'i dus na yab rgyal po de ni da ltar nga'i yab zas gtsang ma zhes bya bar gyur to // de'i tshe de'i dus na yum du gyur pa de ni gzhan yin pa snyam du khyod sems na /
translated: The king who was the father at that time, on that occasion, was King Śuddhodana here.

original: de de ltar mi lta'o //
analyzed: de de ltar mi lta'o //
translated: If you think that the mother at that time, on that occasion, was someone else, you should not regard her in that way.

original: de ni da ltar nga'i yum lha mdzes zhes bya ba yin no //🔽de'i tshe de'i dus na rgyal bu don grub ces bya bar gyur pa de gzhan zhig yin snyam du khyod sems na /
analyzed: de ni da ltar nga'i yum lha mdzes zhes bya ba yin no // de'i tshe de'i dus na rgyal bu don grub ces bya bar gyur pa de gzhan zhig yin snyam du khyod sems na /
translated: She was Queen Māyā here.

original: de de ltar mi lta'o //
analyzed: de de ltar mi lta'o //
translated: If you think that the prince named Siddhārtha at that time, on that occasion, was someone else, you should not regard him in that way.🔽He was me.

original: de'i tshe de'i dus na rgyal bu de ni da ltar sh'akya thub pa zhes bya ba nga yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe de'i dus na rgyal bu de ni da ltar sh'akya thub pa zhes bya ba nga yin no //
translated: At that time, that prince was me, who am now called Shakyamuni.

original: de'i tshe de'i dus na brgya byin lha'i dbang por gyur pa de ni da ltar kun shes koondi n+ya zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe de'i dus na brgya byin lha'i dbang por gyur pa de ni da ltar kun shes koondi n+ya zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: At that time, the one who became the lord of the gods was now called Kon-di-nya.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi pha ma la sri zhu byed pa'i le'u 'di bstan pa'i tshe /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi pha ma la sri zhu byed pa'i le'u 'di bstan pa'i tshe /
translated: When this chapter on the service to the parents of the Lord was taught,

original: 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor de na byang chub sems dpa' khri phrag nyi shu snyed kyi 'gro ba thams cad la phan pa dang / bde ba'i don la mkhas pa'i tshig gi spobs pa thob par gyur to //
analyzed: 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor de na byang chub sems dpa' khri phrag nyi shu snyed kyi 'gro ba thams cad la phan pa dang / bde ba'i don la mkhas pa'i tshig gi spobs pa thob par gyur to //
translated: in that assembly of followers, twenty thousand bodhisattvas attained the eloquence of words skilled in the meaning of benefit and happiness for all beings.

original: byang chub sems dpa' khri phrag bcu @161b gnyis kyis mi skye ba'i chos la chos kyi bzod pa thob bo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' khri phrag bcu @161b gnyis kyis mi skye ba'i chos la chos kyi bzod pa thob bo //
translated: Twelve thousand bodhisattvas attained the acceptance of the non-arising of dharmas.

original: gzhan yang / phyogs bcu nas 'dus pa'i nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / rdul phra rab snyed kyis theg pa gnyis kyi sems spangs te /
analyzed: gzhan yang / phyogs bcu nas 'dus pa'i nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / rdul phra rab snyed kyis theg pa gnyis kyi sems spangs te /
translated: Moreover, the shravakas and pratyekabuddhas who had gathered from the ten directions, as numerous as the atoms, abandoned the two vehicles

original: theg pa gcig gis mthar phyin par gyur to //🔽dge bsnyen dang / dge bsnyen ma rdul phra rab snyed kyis 'bras bu dang po nas /
analyzed: theg pa gcig gis mthar phyin par gyur to // dge bsnyen dang / dge bsnyen ma rdul phra rab snyed kyis 'bras bu dang po nas /
translated: They all reached the ultimate goal of the One Vehicle.

original: theg pa gnyis kyi 'bras bu'i bar du thob par gyur to //
analyzed: theg pa gnyis kyi 'bras bu'i bar du thob par gyur to //
translated: Upāsakas and upāsikās as numerous as the sands of the Ganges all attained the first fruition, and some reached the fruition of the two vehicles.

original: lha dang / mi brgya stong snyed ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed do //
analyzed: lha dang / mi brgya stong snyed ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed do //
translated: Hundreds of thousands of gods and humans generated the intention to achieve unsurpassable and perfect awakening.

original: de ma yin pa lha dang / klu dang / yi dvags dang / lha ma yin dang / dri za dang; nam mkha' lding dang / mi'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po dang / mi dang / mi ma lags pa la sogs pa'i tshogs mang po rnams la la ni bla na med pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa nas /
analyzed: de ma yin pa lha dang / klu dang / yi dvags dang / lha ma yin dang / dri za dang; nam mkha' lding dang / mi'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po dang / mi dang / mi ma lags pa la sogs pa'i tshogs mang po rnams la la ni bla na med pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa nas /
translated: Moreover, many assemblies of gods, nāgas, pretas, asuras, gandharvas, garuḍas, kiṃnaras, mahoragas, humans, non-humans, and others generated the intention to achieve unsurpassable awakening,

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi bar du sems bskyed par gyur to //
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi bar du sems bskyed par gyur to //
translated: and some generated the intention to achieve the awakening of śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kun dga' bo la bka' stsal pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' dag gis sems can thams cad kyi don du pha ma la sri zhu bya ba'i phyir lus kyi sha dang / khrag gis kyang pha ma la bstabs shing /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kun dga' bo la bka' stsal pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' dag gis sems can thams cad kyi don du pha ma la sri zhu bya ba'i phyir lus kyi sha dang / khrag gis kyang pha ma la bstabs shing /
translated: “The bodhisattvas, for the sake of all sentient beings, in order to serve their parents, even offered their own flesh and blood to their parents.

original: shin tu spyad dka' ba spyod pa ni 'di lta bu yin no //
analyzed: shin tu spyad dka' ba spyod pa ni 'di lta bu yin no //
translated: The practice they engaged in was like this.”

original: 'khor mang po thams cad kyis sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa thos nas /
analyzed: 'khor mang po thams cad kyis sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa thos nas /
translated: When the entire great assembly heard the Buddha’s teaching,

original: so so nas phan pa dang / bde ba'i don rnyed de /🔽dga' mgu rangs nas mgo bos phyag btsal te /
analyzed: so so nas phan pa dang / bde ba'i don rnyed de / dga' mgu rangs nas mgo bos phyag btsal te /
translated: they each found the meaning of benefit and happiness.

original: g-yas phyogs @162a *//
analyzed: g-yas phyogs @162a *//
translated: They were delighted, joyful, and elated, and bowed their heads in reverence.🔽They circumambulated to the right

original: nas bskor ba byas nas phyir dong ngo //🔽thabs mkhas pa chen po sangs rgyas drin lan bsab pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: nas bskor ba byas nas phyir dong ngo // thabs mkhas pa chen po sangs rgyas drin lan bsab pa'i mdo las /
translated: and then departed.

original: sri zhu'i le'u zhes bya ste gnyis pa'o ////
analyzed: sri zhu'i le'u zhes bya ste gnyis pa'o ////
translated: This was the second chapter in the sūtra of the skillful great method, the Buddha’s repayment of kindness, called “Serving.”

original: thabs mkhas pa chen po sangs rgyas drin lan bsab pa'i mdo /
analyzed: thabs mkhas pa chen po sangs rgyas drin lan bsab pa'i mdo /
translated: Sūtra of the Skillful Great Method, the Buddha’s Repayment of Kindness

original: bam po gnyis pa /
analyzed: bam po gnyis pa /
translated: Scroll Two

original: de'i tshe de'i dus na bcom ldan 'das 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor mang po'i nang na /
analyzed: de'i tshe de'i dus na bcom ldan 'das 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor mang po'i nang na /
translated: At that time, in the midst of the many circles of the retinue,

original: nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gyis skar ma mang po zil gyis mnan pa lta bu 'am /
analyzed: nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gyis skar ma mang po zil gyis mnan pa lta bu 'am /
translated: the Bhagavān was like the sun’s orb outshining the many stars,

original: klu 'khyil ba'i 'ja' tshon ltar 'tsher zhing gsal ba la lta na mig mi chags pa bzhin nam /
analyzed: klu 'khyil ba'i 'ja' tshon ltar 'tsher zhing gsal ba la lta na mig mi chags pa bzhin nam /
translated: or like a rainbow encircling a nāga, shining and clear, such that if one looked at it, one’s eyes would not be satisfied,

original: bsam na yid 'phrul ba tsam du 'od zer lham me lhang nger bzhugs te dper mi bzod pa ni srin bu me khyer gyis 'od nyi ma shar ma thag tu mi snang pa'am /
analyzed: bsam na yid 'phrul ba tsam du 'od zer lham me lhang nger bzhugs te dper mi bzod pa ni srin bu me khyer gyis 'od nyi ma shar ma thag tu mi snang pa'am /
translated: or if one thought about it, one’s mind would be amazed. His radiance was beyond compare, like fireflies disappearing as soon as the sun rises,

original: nyi zla la 'od zer brgya stong snyed yod kyang brgya byin gyis drung na sol phung lta bu 'am /🔽brgya byin la 'od gsal ba yod kyang /
analyzed: nyi zla la 'od zer brgya stong snyed yod kyang brgya byin gyis drung na sol phung lta bu 'am / brgya byin la 'od gsal ba yod kyang /
translated: or like the sun and moon having hundreds of thousands of light rays, but in the presence of Śakra they are like a pile of coal,🔽or like Śakra having bright light,

original: tshangs pa chen po'i 'od zer gyi drung na gyo mo 'am /
analyzed: tshangs pa chen po'i 'od zer gyi drung na gyo mo 'am /
translated: but in the presence of the light rays of Mahābrahmā they are like pebbles

original: gseg ma lta bu 'am /
analyzed: gseg ma lta bu 'am /
translated: or gravel,

original: mtshan mo dang / nor bu rin po che'i 'od du bskrun pa tsam mam /
analyzed: mtshan mo dang / nor bu rin po che'i 'od du bskrun pa tsam mam /
translated: or like the light of the night and the light of precious jewels being eclipsed.

original: tshangs pa'i rgyal po chen po la 'od zer dam pa brgya stong snyed yod pa'i 'od thams cad kyang /
analyzed: tshangs pa'i rgyal po chen po la 'od zer dam pa brgya stong snyed yod pa'i 'od thams cad kyang /
translated: Great King of Brahmā, the light of the Tathāgata is so bright that it outshines the light of the great king of Brahmā by a thousand or a hundred thousand times.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'od zer gyi drung na sol ba'i phung po ltar gyur to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'od zer gyi drung na sol ba'i phung po ltar gyur to //
translated: In the presence of the Tathāgata’s light, the light of the great king of Brahmā is like a pile of charcoal.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it so?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'od zer gyi mdog gang gis phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams kun tu snang bar gyur to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'od zer gyi mdog gang gis phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams kun tu snang bar gyur to //
translated: The color of the Tathāgata’s light illuminates the worlds in the ten directions.

original: @162b de dag na gnas pa'i sems can dag la 'od zer des reg na /
analyzed: @162b de dag na gnas pa'i sems can dag la 'od zer des reg na /
translated: When sentient beings dwelling there are touched by that light,

original: dmus long ni mig gis gzugs mthong bar 'gyur /
analyzed: dmus long ni mig gis gzugs mthong bar 'gyur /
translated: the blind will be able to see forms with their eyes.

original: lus sgur bo ni lus rangs par 'gyur /
analyzed: lus sgur bo ni lus rangs par 'gyur /
translated: The hunchbacked will have straight bodies.

original: dbang po nyams pa rnams ni dbang po tshang zhing yan lag dang / nying lag dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbang po nyams pa rnams ni dbang po tshang zhing yan lag dang / nying lag dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Those with impaired faculties will have complete faculties and limbs and fingers.

original: myos pa rnams ni dran pa phyir rnyed par 'gyur /
analyzed: myos pa rnams ni dran pa phyir rnyed par 'gyur /
translated: The insane will regain their memories.

original: mdor na ji tsam du yid du mi 'ong ba thams cad dang bral te 'dod pa bzhin thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mdor na ji tsam du yid du mi 'ong ba thams cad dang bral te 'dod pa bzhin thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: In short, they will be free from all that is unpleasant and obtain what they desire.

original: de'i tshe 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor de nyid du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bdun cu snyed stan las langs nas /
analyzed: de'i tshe 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor de nyid du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bdun cu snyed stan las langs nas /
translated: At that time, in that very maṇḍala assembly, about seventy bodhisattva mahāsattvas rose from their seats,

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag btsal te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag btsal te /
translated: bowed their heads to the feet of the Buddha,

original: lan brgya stong bskor ba byas nas phyogs gcig tu 'khod de /
analyzed: lan brgya stong bskor ba byas nas phyogs gcig tu 'khod de /
translated: circumambulated him a hundred thousand times, and then sat to one side.

original: thams cad kyis skad mthun par tshigs su bcad pa brgya stong gis de bzhin gshegs pa la mngon par bstod pa byas pa la /
analyzed: thams cad kyis skad mthun par tshigs su bcad pa brgya stong gis de bzhin gshegs pa la mngon par bstod pa byas pa la /
translated: All of them, with one voice, praised the Tathāgata with a hundred thousand verses.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They were as follows:

original: byang chub sems dpa' bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' rtog med dbyangs dang / byang chub sems dpa' bde ba 'ba' zhig sems dang / byang chub sems dpa' dri ma med par grags pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' tshad med dbyings dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' rtog med dbyangs dang / byang chub sems dpa' bde ba 'ba' zhig sems dang / byang chub sems dpa' dri ma med par grags pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' tshad med dbyings dang /
translated: The bodhisattva Inconceivable, the bodhisattva Nonconceptual Melody, the bodhisattva Only Blissful Mind, the bodhisattva Vimalakīrti, the bodhisattva Immeasurable Space,

original: byang chub sems dpa' grags pa chen po dang / byang chub sems dpa' gtsug phud 'od dang / byang chub sems dpa' brtan pa'i seng ge dang / byang chub sems dpa' 'ba' zhig rol dang / byang @163a *//
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' grags pa chen po dang / byang chub sems dpa' gtsug phud 'od dang / byang chub sems dpa' brtan pa'i seng ge dang / byang chub sems dpa' 'ba' zhig rol dang / byang @163a *//
translated: the bodhisattva Great Renown, the bodhisattva Crown Radiance, the bodhisattva Steadfast Lion, the bodhisattva Sole Play, the bodhisattva

original: dge ba'i ba shes gnyen la bsnyen cing rtag tu bkur sti byed pa'i sems dang / 'dun pa'i yid kyi chos nyan pa'i sems dang / mi brjed par yid la byed cing /
analyzed: dge ba'i ba shes gnyen la bsnyen cing rtag tu bkur sti byed pa'i sems dang / 'dun pa'i yid kyi chos nyan pa'i sems dang / mi brjed par yid la byed cing /
translated: They will have a mind that always respects and serves spiritual friends, a mind that listens to the Dharma with a focused mind, and a mind that is mindful and never forgets.

original: don bzang po gzungs su 'dzin pa'i sems dang; nyung du thos la don mang du shes pa'i sems dang / mang du thos la don mi shes pa mi 'dod pa'i sems skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: don bzang po gzungs su 'dzin pa'i sems dang; nyung du thos la don mang du shes pa'i sems dang / mang du thos la don mi shes pa mi 'dod pa'i sems skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: They will have a mind that retains the excellent meaning, a mind that understands much meaning from little study, and a mind that does not desire to study much without understanding.

original: de nas yang dag nyid la dad pa'i sems dang / de bzhin nyid kyi don bden pa la dad pa'i sems skye bar 'gyur /
analyzed: de nas yang dag nyid la dad pa'i sems dang / de bzhin nyid kyi don bden pa la dad pa'i sems skye bar 'gyur /
translated: Then, they will have a mind that has faith in reality and a mind that has faith in the truth of the meaning of suchness.

original: yang dag pa'i don bden pa la dad pa'i sems skyes pas ji ltar bstan pa bzhin du rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sems skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i don bden pa la dad pa'i sems skyes pas ji ltar bstan pa bzhin du rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sems skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: With the arising of a mind that has faith in the truth of the meaning of reality, a mind that practices yoga in accordance with the teachings will arise.

original: ji ltar bstan pa bzhin du rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sems skyes pas phyir mi ldog pa'i sems skye bar 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar bstan pa bzhin du rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sems skyes pas phyir mi ldog pa'i sems skye bar 'gyur /
translated: With the arising of a mind that practices yoga in accordance with the teachings, an irreversible mind will arise.

original: de ltar phyir mi ldog pa'i sems skyes pas sems can thams cad la mnyam snyoms pa'i gnyen po'i sems skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar phyir mi ldog pa'i sems skyes pas sems can thams cad la mnyam snyoms pa'i gnyen po'i sems skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, by the arising of the irreversible thought, the thought of the remedy that is impartial toward all sentient beings arises.

original: ji ltar bdag khams gsum pa'i srid pa nyi shu rtsa lngar skye bar mi dga' ba bzhin du gzugs yod pa dang / gzugs med pa dang / rkang bzhi dang / rkang mang dang / grog sbur nas srog chags thams cad kyang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: ji ltar bdag khams gsum pa'i srid pa nyi shu rtsa lngar skye bar mi dga' ba bzhin du gzugs yod pa dang / gzugs med pa dang / rkang bzhi dang / rkang mang dang / grog sbur nas srog chags thams cad kyang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: Just as I do not enjoy being born in the twenty-five existences of the three realms, so it is for all sentient beings, from the gods to the worms, in the realms of form, the formless, the four-footed, the many-footed, and the footless.

original: de bas na byang chub sems dpa' ni lus dang / srog @166a *//
analyzed: de bas na byang chub sems dpa' ni lus dang / srog @166a *//
translated: Therefore, the bodhisattva, even at the cost of his body and life,

original: gi bar du stor yang pha rol po'i srog 'phrog pa'i las mi byed do //
analyzed: gi bar du stor yang pha rol po'i srog 'phrog pa'i las mi byed do //
translated: does not take the life of another.

original: ji ltar bdag la nor rdzas dang / 'bru dang / gos dang / zas dang / skom dang; ban glang dang / shing rta dang / theg pa dang / yul dang / grong khyer dang / chung ma dang / bu dang / lus kyi yan lag gi bar du longs spyod rnams la srung zhing rim gro byed do //
analyzed: ji ltar bdag la nor rdzas dang / 'bru dang / gos dang / zas dang / skom dang; ban glang dang / shing rta dang / theg pa dang / yul dang / grong khyer dang / chung ma dang / bu dang / lus kyi yan lag gi bar du longs spyod rnams la srung zhing rim gro byed do //
translated: Just as I protect and serve my own wealth, grain, clothes, food, drink, elephants, horses, carriages, countries, cities, wives, children, and even my limbs,🔽so too should I do for all sentient beings.

original: gzhan gyis khyer zhing 'phrog pa la mi dga' ba bzhin du sems can thams cad kyang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: gzhan gyis khyer zhing 'phrog pa la mi dga' ba bzhin du sems can thams cad kyang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: Just as I do not like it when others steal from me, so too should I do for all sentient beings.

original: de bas na byang chub sems dpa' ni bdag gi lus dang srog stor kyang sems can rnams kyi nor dang / gos dang / zas dang / skom dang / longs spyod la 'phrog pa'i sems mi skyed do //🔽ji ltar bdag gi gzugs dam pa sring mo'am /
analyzed: de bas na byang chub sems dpa' ni bdag gi lus dang srog stor kyang sems can rnams kyi nor dang / gos dang / zas dang / skom dang / longs spyod la 'phrog pa'i sems mi skyed do // ji ltar bdag gi gzugs dam pa sring mo'am /
translated: Therefore, even if I lose my body and life, I will not steal the wealth, clothes, food, drink, and possessions of sentient beings.🔽Just as I do not want others to have illicit relations with my wife,

original: chung ma'am / slas la gzhan gyis mi rigs par byed mi 'dod pa de bzhin du sems can thams cad kyang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: chung ma'am / slas la gzhan gyis mi rigs par byed mi 'dod pa de bzhin du sems can thams cad kyang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: sister, or daughter, so too should I do for all sentient beings.

original: de bas na byang chub sems dpa' ni bdag gi lus dang srog stor kyang /
analyzed: de bas na byang chub sems dpa' ni bdag gi lus dang srog stor kyang /
translated: Therefore, even if a bodhisattva loses his body and life,

original: pha rol po'i gzugs dam pa la 'du shes ngan pa log pa'i sems mi skyed na /
analyzed: pha rol po'i gzugs dam pa la 'du shes ngan pa log pa'i sems mi skyed na /
translated: he does not give rise to a negative, perverted attitude toward the excellent form of others.

original: mi rigs pa'i chos ngan pa lta ci smos /
analyzed: mi rigs pa'i chos ngan pa lta ci smos /
translated: How much less would he engage in improper, evil dharmas!

original: ji ltar bdag phra ma dang tshig rtsub po 'khrug par 'gyur ba la mi dga' ba bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar bdag phra ma dang tshig rtsub po 'khrug par 'gyur ba la mi dga' ba bzhin du /
translated: Just as he dislikes divisive speech and harsh words that lead to conflict,

original: sems can rnams kyang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: so it is with all sentient beings.

original: de bas na byang chub sems dpa' ni bdag gi lus dang / srog @166b yal yang brdzun du smra ba dang / phan tshun 'khrug pa'i tshig mi smra'o //
analyzed: de bas na byang chub sems dpa' ni bdag gi lus dang / srog @166b yal yang brdzun du smra ba dang / phan tshun 'khrug pa'i tshig mi smra'o //
translated: Therefore, even if a bodhisattva loses his body and life, he does not speak falsely or words that lead to conflict.

original: ji ltar bdag rdo dbyug gis rdeg pa dang / lcag gis gzhu ba dang / nan la 'bor ba la mi dga' ba bzhin du sems can thams cad kyang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: ji ltar bdag rdo dbyug gis rdeg pa dang / lcag gis gzhu ba dang / nan la 'bor ba la mi dga' ba bzhin du sems can thams cad kyang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: Just as he dislikes being struck with stones and sticks, whipped, and imprisoned, so it is with all sentient beings.

original: de bas na byang chub sems dpa' ni bdag gi lus dang srog yal yang rdo dbyug dang / lcag dang / chad pas gcad pa'i las kyis sems can rnams la mi 'tshe'o //
analyzed: de bas na byang chub sems dpa' ni bdag gi lus dang srog yal yang rdo dbyug dang / lcag dang / chad pas gcad pa'i las kyis sems can rnams la mi 'tshe'o //
translated: Therefore, even if a bodhisattva’s body and life are taken away, he or she will not harm sentient beings with stones, sticks, whips, or the threat of punishment.

original: ji ltar bdag lcags sgrog dang / khong sgril dang / mtshon cha dang / bzung ba dang / brtags pa dang / bcing bas bcings pa'i gnod pa rnams la mi dga' ba bzhin du sems can kun kyang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: ji ltar bdag lcags sgrog dang / khong sgril dang / mtshon cha dang / bzung ba dang / brtags pa dang / bcing bas bcings pa'i gnod pa rnams la mi dga' ba bzhin du sems can kun kyang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: Just as I do not like it when I am bound with chains, fetters, and shackles, and when I am attacked, robbed, beaten, and imprisoned, so it is for all sentient beings.

original: de bas na byang chub sems dpa' ni lus dang / srog yal yang lcags sgrog dang / khong sgril dang / bzung ba dang / bcing ba la sogs pa'i gnod pas 'tshe bar mi byed do //
analyzed: de bas na byang chub sems dpa' ni lus dang / srog yal yang lcags sgrog dang / khong sgril dang / bzung ba dang / bcing ba la sogs pa'i gnod pas 'tshe bar mi byed do //
translated: Therefore, even if a bodhisattva’s body and life are taken away, he or she will not harm sentient beings by binding them with chains, fetters, and shackles, or by attacking, robbing, beating, and imprisoning them.

original: ji ltar bdag gzhan gyis brnyas pa dang / dbang dang / drag shul byed pa dang / dbang rlom btsan byed pa snyems shing ngan du byed pa la mi dga' ba bzhin du sems can thams cad kyang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: ji ltar bdag gzhan gyis brnyas pa dang / dbang dang / drag shul byed pa dang / dbang rlom btsan byed pa snyems shing ngan du byed pa la mi dga' ba bzhin du sems can thams cad kyang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: so it is with all sentient beings.

original: de bas na byang chub sems dpa' ni bdag gcig pu'i lus dang / srog yal yang /
analyzed: de bas na byang chub sems dpa' ni bdag gcig pu'i lus dang / srog yal yang /
translated: Therefore, even if my body and life are at stake,

original: tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i mi rigs pas sems can la gnod pa mi byed do //
analyzed: tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i mi rigs pas sems can la gnod pa mi byed do //
translated: a bodhisattva does not harm sentient beings through improper and unrighteous actions.

original: ji ltar bdag la pha rol po gzhan gyis bkur sti byed cing mchod dam /
analyzed: ji ltar bdag la pha rol po gzhan gyis bkur sti byed cing mchod dam /
translated: Just as I like it when others honor me,

original: tshig snyan pas bstod na /
analyzed: tshig snyan pas bstod na /
translated: praise me with sweet words,

original: bdag bde ba @167a *//
analyzed: bdag bde ba @167a *//
translated: and make offerings to me,

original: ba la dga' ba bzhin du bdag kyang sems can rnams la gos dang / zas dang / skom dang / mal cha dang / nad kyi rkyen rtsi dang / bde ba'i yo byad thams cad kyis sbyin par byed do //
analyzed: ba la dga' ba bzhin du bdag kyang sems can rnams la gos dang / zas dang / skom dang / mal cha dang / nad kyi rkyen rtsi dang / bde ba'i yo byad thams cad kyis sbyin par byed do //
translated: so I should give sentient beings all the necessities for happiness, such as clothing, food, drink, bedding, medicine, and so forth.

original: gal te bdag gis las chen po zhig bsgrub bam /
analyzed: gal te bdag gis las chen po zhig bsgrub bam /
translated: If I am to accomplish some great task,

original: sangs rgyas kyi phyir ram /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi phyir ram /
translated: For the sake of the Buddha,

original: chos kyi phyir ram /🔽dge 'dun gyi phyir ram /
analyzed: chos kyi phyir ram / dge 'dun gyi phyir ram /
translated: for the sake of the Dharma,🔽for the sake of the Saṅgha,

original: don bsgrub pa las blos mi lcogs te /🔽don bsgrub par ma gyur nas mi dga' zhing mya ngan gyis gdungs pa las mkhas pa blo dang ldan pa zhig gis /
analyzed: don bsgrub pa las blos mi lcogs te / don bsgrub par ma gyur nas mi dga' zhing mya ngan gyis gdungs pa las mkhas pa blo dang ldan pa zhig gis /
translated: or for the sake of accomplishing a goal,🔽if one is unable to do so mentally,🔽and if one does not accomplish the goal, one becomes unhappy and is tormented by sorrow.🔽If a wise and intelligent person sees that one is unhappy and sorrowful because one has not accomplished the goal one is trying to accomplish,

original: bdag gis bsgrub pa'i don ma grub pas mi dga' zhing mya ngan byed par mthong na bdag la 'di skad zer ro //
analyzed: bdag gis bsgrub pa'i don ma grub pas mi dga' zhing mya ngan byed par mthong na bdag la 'di skad zer ro //
translated: that person will say to oneself,

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: ‘Son of noble family,

original: khyod mi dga' ba ma byed cig /🔽khyod kyi don grub pa'i grogs bya ste /
analyzed: khyod mi dga' ba ma byed cig / khyod kyi don grub pa'i grogs bya ste /
translated: do not be unhappy.🔽I will help you to accomplish your goal.

original: don yid bzhin du grub par bya'o zhes zer na /
analyzed: don yid bzhin du grub par bya'o zhes zer na /
translated: I will help you to accomplish your goal as you wish.’

original: de la rab tu dga' ba'i sems skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la rab tu dga' ba'i sems skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: One will feel very happy about that.

original: de bas na bdag gis sems can la phan pa dang / bde ba'i don du bsgrub pa'i las kyis grogs bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na bdag gis sems can la phan pa dang / bde ba'i don du bsgrub pa'i las kyis grogs bya'o //
translated: Therefore, I will help sentient beings with the activity of accomplishing what is beneficial and happy for them.

original: ji ltar bdag la rgyal po dang / rkun po dang / chu'am /
analyzed: ji ltar bdag la rgyal po dang / rkun po dang / chu'am /
translated: Just as the king, thieves, water,

original: mes gnod par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: mes gnod par 'gyur ram /
translated: or fire might harm me,

original: blon po la sogs pas bzung ngam /
analyzed: blon po la sogs pas bzung ngam /
translated: or if I am seized by ministers and so forth,

original: btags sam / bcings na mi dga' ba'i mya ngan gyis gdungs par gyur pa las mkhas pa blo dang ldan pa zhig gis bdag de ltar mya ngan gyis gdungs pa mthong na /
analyzed: btags sam / bcings na mi dga' ba'i mya ngan gyis gdungs par gyur pa las mkhas pa blo dang ldan pa zhig gis bdag de ltar mya ngan gyis gdungs pa mthong na /
translated: A wise and intelligent person sees that he is tormented by such suffering.

original: snyan pa sgra'i tshig gis bdag @167b la khyed mya ngan ma byed cig /🔽khyod kyi phyir kho bos rgyal po'am /
analyzed: snyan pa sgra'i tshig gis bdag @167b la khyed mya ngan ma byed cig / khyod kyi phyir kho bos rgyal po'am /
translated: He says to him, ‘Do not be sorrowful.

original: blon po chen po la gsol ba btab ste /
analyzed: blon po chen po la gsol ba btab ste /
translated: For your sake, I will petition the king or a great minister.

original: gal te na nor gsug sbyin pa'am /
analyzed: gal te na nor gsug sbyin pa'am /
translated: If necessary, I will give up my wealth or

original: thabs rnam pa sna tshogs kyis ci nas kyang khyod mi bde ba'i sdug bsngal las thar bar bya'o zhes zer na /
analyzed: thabs rnam pa sna tshogs kyis ci nas kyang khyod mi bde ba'i sdug bsngal las thar bar bya'o zhes zer na /
translated: by various means, I will do whatever it takes to free you from the suffering of being unhappy.’

original: bdag gis tshig de thos pa tsam gyis sems dga' bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: bdag gis tshig de thos pa tsam gyis sems dga' bar 'gyur te /
translated: The moment he hears those words, his mind is filled with joy.

original: de bas na byang chub sems dpa' ni shes par bya ba'i sgyu rtsal dang / bzo'i bar du yang mthar phyin par brtson 'grus su slob bo //
analyzed: de bas na byang chub sems dpa' ni shes par bya ba'i sgyu rtsal dang / bzo'i bar du yang mthar phyin par brtson 'grus su slob bo //
translated: Therefore, a bodhisattva strives with perseverance to perfect the arts and crafts that are to be known.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /

analyzed: shes par bya ba rig pa'i gnas dang / bzo'i gnas dang / rol mo dang; rtsed mo dang / grangs dang / rtsis dang / mig 'phrul gyi sngags dang / sman dang / ban glang dang / rta dang / bzhon pa dang / dgra chos dang /
translated: He studies the sciences of knowledge, the arts, music, games, numbers, calculation, magic spells, medicine, elephants, horses, vehicles, and military affairs.

original: dmag drang ba dang / dpyad la sogs pa la mkhas par slob ste /
analyzed: dmag drang ba dang / dpyad la sogs pa la mkhas par slob ste /

analyzed: de ltar sgyu rtsal ci la yang mkhas par bslabs nas /

analyzed: 'gro ba mang po dang / rgyal po dang / blon po chen po la sogs pa yang bsams pa'i yid dang 'gal bar mi byed /
