analyzed: skye bo mang po dang smra zhing gtam zer yang /
translated: He speaks and converses with many people,

original: sems ni rtag tu gnyen po'i sgor 'jug par byed do //
analyzed: sems ni rtag tu gnyen po'i sgor 'jug par byed do //
translated: but his mind is always focused on the path of the antidotes.

original: so so'i skye bo dang spyod tshul mthun pa ltar byed kyang sems can la phan pa'i don du nor bu rin po che gtong bar byed kyi /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo dang spyod tshul mthun pa ltar byed kyang sems can la phan pa'i don du nor bu rin po che gtong bar byed kyi /
translated: He acts in accordance with the behavior of ordinary people, but he gives away even the precious jewel for the sake of benefiting sentient beings.

original: sems can la gnod pa mi phan pa'i don mi byed do //
analyzed: sems can la gnod pa mi phan pa'i don mi byed do //
translated: He does not act for the sake of harming sentient beings or for the sake of his own benefit.

original: gang dbul ba phongs pa nyam thag par gyur pa dag byang chub sems dpa' la slong @168b du 'ongs na /
analyzed: gang dbul ba phongs pa nyam thag par gyur pa dag byang chub sems dpa' la slong @168b du 'ongs na /
translated: When those who are poor and destitute, who are suffering, come to the bodhisattva to ask for something,

original: de la ci 'dod pa bzhin byang chub sems dpa' sbyin par byed do //
analyzed: de la ci 'dod pa bzhin byang chub sems dpa' sbyin par byed do //
translated: he gives to them whatever they desire.

original: sems can gang zhig sangs rgyas kyi chos la mos shing dad de /
analyzed: sems can gang zhig sangs rgyas kyi chos la mos shing dad de /
translated: There are sentient beings who have faith in and devotion to the Buddha’s teachings.

original: byang chub sems dpa' la bsnyen bkur dang / mchod pa bya ba'i phyir rim gro dang / g-yog byed cing /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' la bsnyen bkur dang / mchod pa bya ba'i phyir rim gro dang / g-yog byed cing /
translated: They serve and attend on the bodhisattva in order to honor and worship him.

original: rkang pa 'khru ba'i las byed dam /
analyzed: rkang pa 'khru ba'i las byed dam /
translated: “Do you want me to wash your feet?

original: lus bkru ba dang / mnye ba'i las byed dam /
analyzed: lus bkru ba dang / mnye ba'i las byed dam /
translated: Do you want me to wash your body and massage it?

original: chag chag dang / phyag dar byed dam /
analyzed: chag chag dang / phyag dar byed dam /
translated: Do you want me to sweep and clean?

original: so shing dang / khrus chur sbyor ram /
analyzed: so shing dang / khrus chur sbyor ram /
translated: Do you want me to prepare the tooth cleaner and the water for washing the face?

original: mal stan 'dings shing /
analyzed: mal stan 'dings shing /
translated: Do you want me to prepare the bed?

original: mal gos spug pa'i las byed dam /
analyzed: mal gos spug pa'i las byed dam /
translated: Do you want me to prepare the bedding?

original: srod dang / tho rang sa la mar me 'bud dam /
analyzed: srod dang / tho rang sa la mar me 'bud dam /
translated: Do you want me to light the lamp in the evening and in the morning?

original: khye'u sus dang / dro la kha zas tha na pa na dang / pu she ni dang / kha da ne 'bul lam /
analyzed: khye'u sus dang / dro la kha zas tha na pa na dang / pu she ni dang / kha da ne 'bul lam /
translated: Do you want me to offer you food, such as panaka, pūpēna, and khādanēna, in the morning and in the evening?

original: 'thung ba'i skom yu li shi dang / bu lar sha ka'i 'bras bu'i skom dang / rgun chu dang / kha ra nag po'i chu la sogs pa sbyar sbyar nas /
analyzed: 'thung ba'i skom yu li shi dang / bu lar sha ka'i 'bras bu'i skom dang / rgun chu dang / kha ra nag po'i chu la sogs pa sbyar sbyar nas /
translated: Do you want me to prepare a drink, such as yūliśa, the drink made from the fruit of the bulāśaka tree, grape juice, or black sugar water?

original: yo byad de lta bus zhag bdun nam /
analyzed: yo byad de lta bus zhag bdun nam /
translated: Do you want me to offer you these things for seven days or

original: zhag dug bcu'i bar du byang chub sems dpa' la chos 'dod pa'i phyir 'bul bar byed na /
analyzed: zhag dug bcu'i bar du byang chub sems dpa' la chos 'dod pa'i phyir 'bul bar byed na /
translated: for ten days, in order to please the bodhisattva?”

original: byang chub sems dpa' de'i tshe mchod pa'i yo byad 'bul ba de la dga' ba'i sems med do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de'i tshe mchod pa'i yo byad 'bul ba de la dga' ba'i sems med do //
translated: “At that time, the bodhisattva will not be pleased by the offering of these things.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni bskal pa grangs med pa yun ring po nas sangs rgyas kyi chos tshol ba'i phyir /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni bskal pa grangs med pa yun ring po nas sangs rgyas kyi chos tshol ba'i phyir /
translated: Bodhisattvas, for a long time over countless eons, seek the Buddha’s teachings.

original: sems can thams cad la skyed 'bri'i sems med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sems can thams cad la skyed 'bri'i sems med pa'i phyir /
translated: They have no thoughts of contempt for any sentient being.

original: byams pa dang / snying rje'i sems dang ldan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: byams pa dang / snying rje'i sems dang ldan pa'i phyir /
translated: They have thoughts of loving kindness and compassion.

original: mnyam snyoms pa'i sems la @169a *//🔽gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mnyam snyoms pa'i sems la @169a *// gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They abide in thoughts of equality.

original: de bas na dus kha cig tu 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po byed de /
analyzed: de bas na dus kha cig tu 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po byed de /
translated: Therefore, at some times they act as universal monarchs.

original: rtag tu dge ba bcu'i chos kyis sems can gyi don byed do //
analyzed: rtag tu dge ba bcu'i chos kyis sems can gyi don byed do //
translated: They always benefit sentient beings with the ten wholesome actions.

original: sems can de dag kyang rgyal po'i yid bzhin du dga' zhing spyod pa'i tshe'i dus byas na yang lha dang / mi'i 'jig rten du 'dod pa lnga'i longs spyod mchog dam pa dang ldan te /
analyzed: sems can de dag kyang rgyal po'i yid bzhin du dga' zhing spyod pa'i tshe'i dus byas na yang lha dang / mi'i 'jig rten du 'dod pa lnga'i longs spyod mchog dam pa dang ldan te /
translated: When those sentient beings, happy and joyful as if they were the king’s mind, die, they are endowed with the supreme enjoyments of the five kinds of objects of desire in the worlds of gods and humans.

original: rigs che zhing mtho bar skye bar 'gyur /
analyzed: rigs che zhing mtho bar skye bar 'gyur /
translated: They are born into a family that is of high caste.

original: bsams pa'i yid bzhin du nyal ba dang / ldang ba dang / 'gro ba la gnod pa med par 'gyur /
analyzed: bsams pa'i yid bzhin du nyal ba dang / ldang ba dang / 'gro ba la gnod pa med par 'gyur /
translated: They sleep, rise, and go about as they wish, without any harm.

original: gnas gang du 'gro yang bzhon pa'i rta dang theg par ldan pa ste skyed mos tshal tu rtsed mo dang / rol mo la rtse zhing longs spyod par 'gyur /
analyzed: gnas gang du 'gro yang bzhon pa'i rta dang theg par ldan pa ste skyed mos tshal tu rtsed mo dang / rol mo la rtse zhing longs spyod par 'gyur /
translated: Wherever they go, they are accompanied by horses and vehicles. They enjoy themselves in parks, playing and making music.

original: bza' ba dang / btung ba dam pa dang / dga' mgur spyod par 'gyur yang /
analyzed: bza' ba dang / btung ba dam pa dang / dga' mgur spyod par 'gyur yang /
translated: They have the best food and drink and enjoy themselves as they please.

original: tha ma mi rtag pa brten te rga ba dang / na bas gzir te /
analyzed: tha ma mi rtag pa brten te rga ba dang / na bas gzir te /
translated: But in the end, they are impermanent. They are afflicted by old age and sickness.

original: shi bar gyur na /
analyzed: shi bar gyur na /
translated: When they die,

original: khyim gyi bu smad mya ngan gyis gdungs te skad phyung nas ngu zhing /🔽la la ni mgo la thal mo rdebs /
analyzed: khyim gyi bu smad mya ngan gyis gdungs te skad phyung nas ngu zhing / la la ni mgo la thal mo rdebs /
translated: their family members are tormented by grief. They cry out and weep.🔽Some beat their heads with their palms.

original: la la ni rang rang gi skra 'bal te /
analyzed: la la ni rang rang gi skra 'bal te /
translated: Some pull out their hair.

original: mchi ma 'dzag cing sa la 'dre'o //🔽de nas 'khyogs sam /
analyzed: mchi ma 'dzag cing sa la 'dre'o // de nas 'khyogs sam /
translated: They shed tears and roll on the ground.🔽Then they carry the corpse on a stretcher

original: shing rta'i steng du bzhag nas /
analyzed: shing rta'i steng du bzhag nas /
translated: or on a chariot.

original: dur khrod du bskyal te /
analyzed: dur khrod du bskyal te /
translated: They take it to the charnel ground.

original: de ltar bskyal nas kyang bu smad dag phyir khyim du 'ongs nas mya ngan gyis gdungs te /
analyzed: de ltar bskyal nas kyang bu smad dag phyir khyim du 'ongs nas mya ngan gyis gdungs te /
translated: After they have taken it there, the family members return home and are tormented by grief.

original: la la ni brgyal nas sa la 'gre /
analyzed: la la ni brgyal nas sa la 'gre /
translated: Some faint and fall to the ground.

original: la la ni de'i rkyen gyis nad du gyur /
analyzed: la la ni de'i rkyen gyis nad du gyur /
translated: Some become ill because of it.

original: la la ni mi dran pas myos /
analyzed: la la ni mi dran pas myos /
translated: Some were confused because they could not remember.

original: la la tshe'i @169b bar chad du shi bar byas te /
analyzed: la la tshe'i @169b bar chad du shi bar byas te /
translated: Some died because their lives were cut short.

original: de ltar byas kyang gson pa rnams la ni phan pa med /
analyzed: de ltar byas kyang gson pa rnams la ni phan pa med /
translated: Even though this was done, it did not benefit those who lived.

original: shi ba la ni rab tu gnod do //
analyzed: shi ba la ni rab tu gnod do //
translated: It was a great harm to those who died.

original: de'i tshe de'i dus na 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po 'khor dang bcas te yul rgyu zhing song ba las /
analyzed: de'i tshe de'i dus na 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po 'khor dang bcas te yul rgyu zhing song ba las /
translated: At that time, the universal monarch, together with his retinue, went to the country to travel.

original: sems can mya ngan gyis gzir ba mthong nas snying brtse ba'i sems skyes te 'di skad zer ro //
analyzed: sems can mya ngan gyis gzir ba mthong nas snying brtse ba'i sems skyes te 'di skad zer ro //
translated: Seeing that sentient beings were afflicted with suffering, a compassionate mind arose and he said this:

original: rgyal po zhes bya ba ni yul sa dbang gis 'gro ba mang po'i dbang bsgyur te /
analyzed: rgyal po zhes bya ba ni yul sa dbang gis 'gro ba mang po'i dbang bsgyur te /
translated: The so-called king, by the power of the land, rules over many beings.

original: de ltar dge ba bcu'i lam gyis 'gro ba rnams 'dul te /
analyzed: de ltar dge ba bcu'i lam gyis 'gro ba rnams 'dul te /
translated: In that way, he guides beings through the path of the ten virtues.

original: 'bras bu 'dod pa lnga mchog dam pa thob tu zin kyang skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba dang / mi rtag pa 'jigs pa las thar par ma gyur na bdag gis drang po'i chos kyis yul gyi srid btsas kyang phan pa'i don med do //
analyzed: 'bras bu 'dod pa lnga mchog dam pa thob tu zin kyang skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba dang / mi rtag pa 'jigs pa las thar par ma gyur na bdag gis drang po'i chos kyis yul gyi srid btsas kyang phan pa'i don med do //
translated: Even if I were to obtain the five supreme and excellent fruits of my desires, if I were not liberated from the fears of birth, old age, sickness, death, and impermanence, then even if I were to rule the country with the Dharma, it would be meaningless.

original: de ltar 'gro ba rnams la phan pa'i don med na /
analyzed: de ltar 'gro ba rnams la phan pa'i don med na /
translated: If I were to be of no benefit to sentient beings,

original: 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po chen po zhes kyang ji skad ces kyang bya /
analyzed: 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po chen po zhes kyang ji skad ces kyang bya /
translated: how could I be called a great universal monarch?

original: byams pa chen po pha zhe'am /
analyzed: byams pa chen po pha zhe'am /
translated: How could I be called a great father of loving kindness?

original: sman pa'i rgyal po chen po zhe'am /
analyzed: sman pa'i rgyal po chen po zhe'am /
translated: How could I be called a great king of physicians?

original: 'dren pa'i ston pa chen po zhes ji skad du gdags /
analyzed: 'dren pa'i ston pa chen po zhes ji skad du gdags /
translated: How could I be called a great guide and teacher?

original: 'dren pa'i ston pa chen po zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'dren pa'i ston pa chen po zhes bya ba ni /
translated: A great guide and teacher

original: yang dag pa'i lam du 'dren cing /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lam du 'dren cing /
translated: leads to the true path

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam ston te /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam ston te /
translated: and teaches the path to nirvāṇa.

original: 'dus ma byas pa'i rab tu bde ba thob par byed do //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas pa'i rab tu bde ba thob par byed do //
translated: It causes the attainment of the bliss of the unconditioned.

original: bdag cag ni ming dang / spyod par mi mthun te /
analyzed: bdag cag ni ming dang / spyod par mi mthun te /
translated: We are not in accord with names and conduct.

original: dper na / mi zhig skom pas gdungs nas srog la bab pa las /
analyzed: dper na / mi zhig skom pas gdungs nas srog la bab pa las /
translated: For example, a man was tormented by thirst and was about to die.

original: chu 'dod pa'i phyir phan tshun rgyugs te @170a *//
analyzed: chu 'dod pa'i phyir phan tshun rgyugs te @170a *//
translated: In order to find water, he ran around here and there.

original: khron pa skam po zhig dang phrad nas rab tu dga' ba'i sems skyes te 'di snyam du sems so //
analyzed: khron pa skam po zhig dang phrad nas rab tu dga' ba'i sems skyes te 'di snyam du sems so //
translated: He came across a dry well and a thought of great joy arose in him. He thought like this:

original: da ni bdag gi lus 'di 'chi ba las phyir sos so //
analyzed: da ni bdag gi lus 'di 'chi ba las phyir sos so //
translated: “Now, my body has revived from death.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gal te chu dang ma phrad na /
analyzed: gal te chu dang ma phrad na /
translated: If I had not encountered water,

original: srog 'di 'chi ba las yun mi ring ba las da khron pa bzang po dang phrad nas /
analyzed: srog 'di 'chi ba las yun mi ring ba las da khron pa bzang po dang phrad nas /
translated: this life would not have lasted long. Now, having encountered a good well,

original: gdon mi za bar chu dong grang mo gtsang ma dang phrad de ngoms shing tshim par 'gyur bas srog 'tsho bar 'gyur ro snyam bsams nas /
analyzed: gdon mi za bar chu dong grang mo gtsang ma dang phrad de ngoms shing tshim par 'gyur bas srog 'tsho bar 'gyur ro snyam bsams nas /
translated: I will certainly encounter a clean, cold spring and be satisfied and content, and my life will be saved.”

original: myur ba myur bar khron pa'i drung du bsnyen to //
analyzed: myur ba myur bar khron pa'i drung du bsnyen to //
translated: He thought like this, and quickly approached the well.

original: khron pa'i drung du phyin nas lus la gyon pa'i gos phud de phyogs gcig tu sbas nas /
analyzed: khron pa'i drung du phyin nas lus la gyon pa'i gos phud de phyogs gcig tu sbas nas /
translated: Having arrived at the well, he took off the clothes on his body and hid them to one side,

original: chu 'dod pa'i phyir khron pa'i nang du zhugs so //
analyzed: chu 'dod pa'i phyir khron pa'i nang du zhugs so //
translated: and in order to find water, he entered the well.

original: khron pa'i gting du phyin nas chu ni med kyi sbrul gdug pa dang / smigs pa dang / sdig pa dang / rtsangs pa dang / sbal ba dang / gyo mo dang / de la sogs pa gseg ma dang / shing dang / rtsa nyal nyil 'ba' zhig mthong bar gyur to //
analyzed: khron pa'i gting du phyin nas chu ni med kyi sbrul gdug pa dang / smigs pa dang / sdig pa dang / rtsangs pa dang / sbal ba dang / gyo mo dang / de la sogs pa gseg ma dang / shing dang / rtsa nyal nyil 'ba' zhig mthong bar gyur to //
translated: He saw only gravel, trees, and grass.

original: de'i tshe skom pas nyam thag par gyur pa de thog ma re ba bzhin du chu yang ma rnyed la gdug pa mang po gzas nas /
analyzed: de'i tshe skom pas nyam thag par gyur pa de thog ma re ba bzhin du chu yang ma rnyed la gdug pa mang po gzas nas /
translated: At that time, he was tormented by thirst. He had not found the water he had hoped for, and he was attacked by many poisonous creatures.

original: khron pa de las phyir byung bar gzas kyang khron pa rnyings shing zhig la zab kyang mda' rgyang gang tsam yod de /
analyzed: khron pa de las phyir byung bar gzas kyang khron pa rnyings shing zhig la zab kyang mda' rgyang gang tsam yod de /
translated: He tried to get out of the well, but the well was deep and narrow, only about the length of an arrow.

original: de'i nang nas skas sam /
analyzed: de'i nang nas skas sam /
translated: There was no ladder in the well,

original: thag srad dam /
analyzed: thag srad dam /
translated: no rope,

original: 'bru ba'i shing tsam yang med de /
analyzed: 'bru ba'i shing tsam yang med de /
translated: and no tree to climb.

original: mas @170b mchong du stsal yang nyam thag la stobs zhan pas 'phar mi nus te /
analyzed: mas @170b mchong du stsal yang nyam thag la stobs zhan pas 'phar mi nus te /
translated: He tried to jump out, but he was weak and could not do it.

original: phyir yang zhabs su lhung nas sbrul gdug pa la sogs pas za zhing 'jib bo //
analyzed: phyir yang zhabs su lhung nas sbrul gdug pa la sogs pas za zhing 'jib bo //
translated: He fell back into the well and was bitten and stung by poisonous snakes.

original: de cung zad cig srog ma chad kyi bar du 'di skad ces zer ro //
analyzed: de cung zad cig srog ma chad kyi bar du 'di skad ces zer ro //
translated: He said this until his life was almost over.

original: bdag khron pa 'di'i nang na chu med par sngar shes na lha khron pa la mig gis lta yang mi phod na 'di'i nang du zhugs pa lta smos kyang ci dgos te /
analyzed: bdag khron pa 'di'i nang na chu med par sngar shes na lha khron pa la mig gis lta yang mi phod na 'di'i nang du zhugs pa lta smos kyang ci dgos te /
translated: “If I had known earlier that this well was dry, I would not have looked at it, let alone entered it.

original: de ni khron pa 'di'i rkyen gyis sdug bsngal ba'i sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni khron pa 'di'i rkyen gyis sdug bsngal ba'i sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Because of this well, I am experiencing the suffering of suffering.”

original: zhes smre sngags 'don no //
analyzed: zhes smre sngags 'don no //
translated: He lamented in this way.

original: 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po yang de ltar so so'i skye bo dag gcig shi ba'i 'og tu khyim gang gis smad dang / gnyen rnams kyi sdug pa dang / bye bral ba'i sdug bsngal gyis gdungs pa mthong nas 'di skad zer ro //
analyzed: 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po yang de ltar so so'i skye bo dag gcig shi ba'i 'og tu khyim gang gis smad dang / gnyen rnams kyi sdug pa dang / bye bral ba'i sdug bsngal gyis gdungs pa mthong nas 'di skad zer ro //
translated: The universal monarch, seeing that when an ordinary person dies, the family members are tormented by the suffering of separation from their loved ones, said this:

original: bdag gi lus 'di ni khron pa skam po de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: bdag gi lus 'di ni khron pa skam po de dang 'dra ste /
translated: “This body of mine is like that dry well.

original: khron pa'i ming tsam yod kyi chu ni med pas na /
analyzed: khron pa'i ming tsam yod kyi chu ni med pas na /
translated: Although the name ‘well’ exists, there is no water.

original: 'jug pa yod kyang thob pa med pas de lta bu'i lus dang / srog stor ba'i sdug bsngal myong bar gyur to //
analyzed: 'jug pa yod kyang thob pa med pas de lta bu'i lus dang / srog stor ba'i sdug bsngal myong bar gyur to //
translated: Although they were able to enter, they did not obtain anything, and so they experienced the suffering of losing their bodies and lives.

original: da ltar bdag 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po'i dbang bsgyur zhing rin po che sna bdun dang ldan te /
analyzed: da ltar bdag 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po'i dbang bsgyur zhing rin po che sna bdun dang ldan te /
translated: Now I am the king of the universal monarch, and I rule with the seven precious things.

original: dge ba bcu'i las kyi 'gro ba 'dul zhing drang po'i chos kyi yul gyi srid btsas nas /
analyzed: dge ba bcu'i las kyi 'gro ba 'dul zhing drang po'i chos kyi yul gyi srid btsas nas /
translated: I discipline the beings of the ten virtuous actions, and I rule the country with the straight Dharma.

original: skye bo mang po dag lha dang / mi'i mtho ris kyi gnas su bkod de /
analyzed: skye bo mang po dag lha dang / mi'i mtho ris kyi gnas su bkod de /
translated: I have established many beings in the heavens of the gods and humans.

original: 'dod pa lnga'i yon tan mchog dam pa la longs spyod du bcug kyang de @171a *//
analyzed: 'dod pa lnga'i yon tan mchog dam pa la longs spyod du bcug kyang de @171a *//
translated: I have made them enjoy the supreme and excellent five desires.

original: dag skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba dang / sdug pa dang / bye bral dang / dgra sdang ba dang phrad pa'i sdug bsngal las thar bar mi nus te /
analyzed: dag skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba dang / sdug pa dang / bye bral dang / dgra sdang ba dang phrad pa'i sdug bsngal las thar bar mi nus te /
translated: However, they are unable to be liberated from the suffering of birth, old age, sickness, death, separation from what is dear, and encountering what is unpleasant.

original: gcig la gcig du zhing cho nge byed pa 'di ni bdag gis nyes kyi /
analyzed: gcig la gcig du zhing cho nge byed pa 'di ni bdag gis nyes kyi /
translated: They cry out to each other, and this is my fault.

original: sems can rnams kyis ma nyes so //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyis ma nyes so //
translated: It is not the fault of the beings.

original: de ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: de ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: bdag la 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos 'gro ba mang po la phan pa'i don du 'gyur ba med de /
analyzed: bdag la 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos 'gro ba mang po la phan pa'i don du 'gyur ba med de /

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ji ltar na drin shes par bgyi /
translated: “World-honored One, how do bodhisattvas know kindness?🔽How do they repay kindness?”

original: ji ltar na drin bsab par bgyi zhes gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' dga' ba'i rgyal po la 'di skad ces bka' @182b stsal to //
analyzed: ji ltar na drin bsab par bgyi zhes gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' dga' ba'i rgyal po la 'di skad ces bka' @182b stsal to //
translated: The Buddha addressed the Bodhisattva Priyaraṣmi, saying:

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: “Good son,

original: legs par nyon cig /
analyzed: legs par nyon cig /
translated: listen well!

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po drin shes pa ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po drin shes pa ni /
translated: Bodhisattvas who know kindness

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'o //
translated: generate the intention to achieve unsurpassable and perfect enlightenment.

original: drin lan bsab pa ni sems can pha rol po thams cad bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed du gzhug pa'o //
analyzed: drin lan bsab pa ni sems can pha rol po thams cad bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed du gzhug pa'o //
translated: Repaying kindness means causing all sentient beings to generate the intention to achieve unsurpassable and perfect enlightenment.🔽”

original: gsol pa; byang chub tu sems bskyed ces bgyi ba /
analyzed: gsol pa; byang chub tu sems bskyed ces bgyi ba /
translated: He asked, “What is meant by ‘generating the intention to achieve enlightenment’?

original: ji ltar sems bskyed par bgyi /
analyzed: ji ltar sems bskyed par bgyi /
translated: How does one generate the intention?

original: byang chub sems dpa' dngos po gang gi rkyen gyis byang chub tu sems bskyed par 'gyur /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' dngos po gang gi rkyen gyis byang chub tu sems bskyed par 'gyur /
translated: What are the conditions for bodhisattvas to generate the intention to achieve enlightenment?”

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of a good family!

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po thog ma bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'i tshe /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po thog ma bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'i tshe /
translated: When the bodhisattva mahāsattva first gives rise to the mind of unsurpassed perfect awakening,

original: 'di skad du; yi dam chen po bca'o //
analyzed: 'di skad du; yi dam chen po bca'o //
translated: he makes a great vow like this:

original: bdag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob pa'i tshe sems can thams cad la phan pa dang / bde ba'i don du /
analyzed: bdag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob pa'i tshe sems can thams cad la phan pa dang / bde ba'i don du /
translated: “When I attain unsurpassed perfect awakening, for the sake of the benefit and happiness of all sentient beings,

original: sems can thams cad mya ngan las 'das pa chen po la nges par dgod par dam bca'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad mya ngan las 'das pa chen po la nges par dgod par dam bca'o //
translated: I vow to establish all sentient beings in great nirvāṇa.

original: gzhan yang / sems can thams cad shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par bya bar dam bca' bar bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang / sems can thams cad shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par bya bar dam bca' bar bya'o //
translated: Moreover, I vow to cause all sentient beings to perfect the perfection of wisdom.

original: de ni bdag gi don dang / gzhan gyi don byed pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de ni bdag gi don dang / gzhan gyi don byed pa zhes bya ste /
translated: That is called ‘acting for one’s own benefit and the benefit of others.’

original: de bas na thog ma byang chub tu sems bskyed nas byang chub kyi rgyu dang ldan pa zhes bya /🔽sems can gyi @183a *//
analyzed: de bas na thog ma byang chub tu sems bskyed nas byang chub kyi rgyu dang ldan pa zhes bya / sems can gyi @183a *//
translated: Therefore, having first given rise to the mind of awakening, one is called ‘endowed with the cause of awakening.’

original: rgyu dang ldan pa zhes bya /
analyzed: rgyu dang ldan pa zhes bya /
translated: One is called ‘endowed with the cause of sentient beings.’

original: yang dag par don gyi rgyu dang ldan pa zhes bya /
analyzed: yang dag par don gyi rgyu dang ldan pa zhes bya /
translated: It is called the true cause of the meaning.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun gyi chos dang ldan pa zhes bya /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun gyi chos dang ldan pa zhes bya /
translated: It is called the Dharma endowed with the thirty-seven factors of awakening.

original: dge ba'i chos thams cad sdud pa'i gzhi zhes bya /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos thams cad sdud pa'i gzhi zhes bya /
translated: It is called the basis for gathering all virtuous dharmas.

original: de bas na byang chub sems dpa' ni dge ba zhes bya /
analyzed: de bas na byang chub sems dpa' ni dge ba zhes bya /
translated: Therefore, the bodhisattva is called virtuous.

original: dge ba chen po zhes bya /
analyzed: dge ba chen po zhes bya /
translated: He is called greatly virtuous.

original: sems can thams cad kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba zhes kyang bya /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba zhes kyang bya /
translated: He is called the root of virtue for all sentient beings.

original: sems can thams cad kyi lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi las sbyong ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi las sbyong ba zhes bya ste /
translated: He is called the one who purifies the actions of the body, speech, and mind of all sentient beings.

original: las ngan pa gsum sbyangs pas 'jig rten na smon lam gang yang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa las 'da' ba med de /
analyzed: las ngan pa gsum sbyangs pas 'jig rten na smon lam gang yang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa las 'da' ba med de /
translated: Because he purifies the three evil actions, there is nothing in the world that surpasses the generation of the mind of unsurpassed perfect awakening.

original: smon lam mchog dam pa bla na med pa'o //
analyzed: smon lam mchog dam pa bla na med pa'o //
translated: It is the unsurpassed, supreme, and holy aspiration.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po thog ma byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'i tshe /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po thog ma byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'i tshe /
translated: When the bodhisattva mahāsattva first generates the mind of awakening,

original: dngos po lnga dang ldan par bya'o //
analyzed: dngos po lnga dang ldan par bya'o //
translated: He should be endowed with five things.

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?🔽The nature, the practice, the sphere, the qualities, and the development.

original: rang bzhin dang / spyod pa dang / spyod yul dang / yon tan dang / bskyed pa'o; ;byang chub sems dpa' sde ltar byang chub tu sems bskyed na /
analyzed: rang bzhin dang / spyod pa dang / spyod yul dang / yon tan dang / bskyed pa'o; ;byang chub sems dpa' sde ltar byang chub tu sems bskyed na /
translated: If a bodhisattva generates the mind of awakening in this way,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes bya ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes bya ste /
translated: he is called a bodhisattva mahāsattva.

original: gdon mi za bar bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob cing theg pa chen po spyod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gdon mi za bar bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob cing theg pa chen po spyod par 'gyur ro //
translated: He will certainly attain unsurpassed perfect awakening and practice the Mahāyāna.

original: de bas na thog ma byang chub tu sems bskyed pas dge ba'i chos thams cad sdud par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na thog ma byang chub tu sems bskyed pas dge ba'i chos thams cad sdud par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, by first generating the mind of awakening, all virtuous dharmas are gathered.

original: @183b byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byang chub tu sems bskyed nas ji ltar spyod pa bzhin du bla na med pa yang dag pa'i byang chub thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: @183b byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byang chub tu sems bskyed nas ji ltar spyod pa bzhin du bla na med pa yang dag pa'i byang chub thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: A bodhisattva mahāsattva, having generated the mind of awakening, will attain unsurpassed perfect awakening just as he practices.

original: gal te byang chub tu sems ma bskyed na /
analyzed: gal te byang chub tu sems ma bskyed na /
translated: If one does not generate the mind of awakening,

original: nam du yang byang chub thob par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: nam du yang byang chub thob par mi 'gyur te /
translated: one will never attain awakening.

original: de bas na byang chub tu sems bskyed na /
analyzed: de bas na byang chub tu sems bskyed na /
translated: Therefore, if one generates the mind of enlightenment,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi gzhi thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi gzhi thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: one will attain the basis of unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po /
translated: The bodhisattva-mahāsattva,

original: sems can sdug bsngal gyis gzir ba mthong na byams shing snying rje ba'i sems skye ste /
analyzed: sems can sdug bsngal gyis gzir ba mthong na byams shing snying rje ba'i sems skye ste /
translated: when seeing sentient beings afflicted by suffering, gives rise to a mind of love and compassion.

original: de bas na byang chub sems dpa' ni byams pa dang snying rje'i sems kyis rgyu byas pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na byang chub sems dpa' ni byams pa dang snying rje'i sems kyis rgyu byas pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the bodhisattva, through the cause of moving with a mind of love and compassion, generates the mind of unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'i rgyus /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'i rgyus /
translated: Through the cause of generating the mind of unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment,

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun bsgrub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun bsgrub par 'gyur ro //
translated: one accomplishes the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun bsgrubs pa'i rgyus /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun bsgrubs pa'i rgyus /
translated: Through the cause of accomplishing the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'thob ste /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'thob ste /
translated: one attains unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: de bas na byang chub tu sems bskyed pa ni gzhi'am /
analyzed: de bas na byang chub tu sems bskyed pa ni gzhi'am /
translated: Therefore, generating the Thought of Enlightenment is the basis.

original: rtsa ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rtsa ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, arousing the mind of awakening is called the basis or root.

original: byang chub tu sems bskyed pas; byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims spyod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: byang chub tu sems bskyed pas; byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims spyod par 'gyur te /
translated: Because of arousing the mind of awakening, the bodhisattva will practice the bodhisattva’s morality.

original: de bas na byang chub tu sems bskyed pa ni rtsa ba zhes bya'o //🔽yan lag ces byang bya /🔽sdud pa zhes kyang @184a *//
analyzed: de bas na byang chub tu sems bskyed pa ni rtsa ba zhes bya'o // yan lag ces byang bya / sdud pa zhes kyang @184a *//
translated: Therefore, arousing the mind of awakening is called the root.🔽It is also called a branch,🔽also called a collection,

original: bya; go rims zhes kyang bya /
analyzed: bya; go rims zhes kyang bya /
translated: also called an order,

original: sa bon zhes kyang bya /
analyzed: sa bon zhes kyang bya /
translated: also called a seed.

original: byang chub sems dpa' byang chub tu sems bskyed pa yang mthar phyin pa dang / mthar mi phyin pa yod de /🔽bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar du thob par byed pa ni nam du yang phyir ldog pa'am /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' byang chub tu sems bskyed pa yang mthar phyin pa dang / mthar mi phyin pa yod de / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar du thob par byed pa ni nam du yang phyir ldog pa'am /
translated: The bodhisattva’s arousing of the mind of awakening may be either definitive or non-definitive.

original: nur ba med pas mthar phyin pa'o //
analyzed: nur ba med pas mthar phyin pa'o //
translated: Up to the attainment of unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, it is definitive because it never turns back or falters.

original: mthar mi phyin pa ni ldog pa dang nyams par 'gyur te /
analyzed: mthar mi phyin pa ni ldog pa dang nyams par 'gyur te /
translated: Non-definitive is when it turns back and degenerates.

original: phyir ldog pa la rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: phyir ldog pa la rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Turning back is of two kinds:

original: mthar ldog pa dang / mthar ldog pa ma yin pa yod do //
analyzed: mthar ldog pa dang / mthar ldog pa ma yin pa yod do //
translated: There is a kind that turns back and a kind that does not turn back.

original: mthar phyir ldog pa ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa las /🔽phyir mi ldog pa'i chos gang yin pa de bsgrub pa'am /
analyzed: mthar phyir ldog pa ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa las / phyir mi ldog pa'i chos gang yin pa de bsgrub pa'am /
translated: That which turns back is the arousing of the thought of supreme perfect enlightenment

original: nan tan du spyod mi nus pa'o //
analyzed: nan tan du spyod mi nus pa'o //
translated: but one is unable to practice and cultivate the dharmas of non-turning back.

original: mthar phyir ldog pa ma yin pa ni byang chub tu sems bskyed nas /🔽chos gang yin pa bsgrub cing /
analyzed: mthar phyir ldog pa ma yin pa ni byang chub tu sems bskyed nas / chos gang yin pa bsgrub cing /
translated: That which does not turn back is the arousing of the thought of enlightenment

original: nan tan du spyod pa'o //
analyzed: nan tan du spyod pa'o //
translated: and one is able to practice and cultivate the dharmas of non-turning back.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la rnam pa bzhi ste /🔽rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la rnam pa bzhi ste / rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: The bodhisattva practice is of four kinds:🔽If a son or daughter of good family

original: rigs kyi bu mo'am /🔽gang zhig sangs rgyas sam /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo'am / gang zhig sangs rgyas sam /
translated: or anyone else

original: byang chub sems dpa'i don gyi dngos po bsam gyis mi khyab pa thos sam /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i don gyi dngos po bsam gyis mi khyab pa thos sam /
translated: hears of or sees the inconceivable things that are the meaning of the Buddha or the bodhisattva,

original: mthong na / de'i tshe dang cing 'dun pa'i sems skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: mthong na / de'i tshe dang cing 'dun pa'i sems skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: then at that time a mind of faith and aspiration is born.

original: 'di snyam du sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa'i don gyi dngos po ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa ste /
analyzed: 'di snyam du sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa'i don gyi dngos po ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa ste /
translated: He thinks, The ultimate reality of the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas is inconceivable.

original: sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems @184b dpa'i don gyi dngos po bsam gyis mi khyab pa de ni thob par bya ba yin pas /
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems @184b dpa'i don gyi dngos po bsam gyis mi khyab pa de ni thob par bya ba yin pas /
translated: Since it is to be attained,

original: bdag gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par bya'o snyam sems te /
analyzed: bdag gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par bya'o snyam sems te /
translated: I shall attain the supreme enlightenment.

original: de bas na sems rtse gcig tu byang chub dran par byed cing /
analyzed: de bas na sems rtse gcig tu byang chub dran par byed cing /
translated: Therefore, he thinks one-pointedly of enlightenment,🔽and arouses the thought of enlightenment.

original: byang chub tu sems bskyed pa dang / kha cig ni sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi don gyi dngos po bsam gyis mi khyab pa ma mthong yang /
analyzed: byang chub tu sems bskyed pa dang / kha cig ni sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi don gyi dngos po bsam gyis mi khyab pa ma mthong yang /
translated: Some, without seeing the inconceivable ultimate reality of the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas,

original: sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpas dgongs te gsungs pa'i snying po thos pa tsam gyis dad cing 'dun pa'i sems skyes te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpas dgongs te gsungs pa'i snying po thos pa tsam gyis dad cing 'dun pa'i sems skyes te /
translated: by merely hearing the essence of the teachings of the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas, arouse a mind of faith and aspiration.

original: dad pa'i sems skyes pas /
analyzed: dad pa'i sems skyes pas /
translated: By arousing a mind of faith,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par bya ba'i phyir byang chub tu sems bskyed pa dang / kha cig ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i don gyi dngos po bsam gyis mi khyab pa yang ma mthong /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par bya ba'i phyir byang chub tu sems bskyed pa dang / kha cig ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i don gyi dngos po bsam gyis mi khyab pa yang ma mthong /
translated: Some, without seeing the inconceivable meaning of the buddhas and bodhisattvas,

original: dgongs te gsungs pa'i chos ma thos kyang dam pa'i chos 'jig par 'gyur bar mthong na /
analyzed: dgongs te gsungs pa'i chos ma thos kyang dam pa'i chos 'jig par 'gyur bar mthong na /
translated: without hearing the Dharma of the intention, see that the sublime Dharma will disappear.

original: de 'di snyam du bla na med pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos sems can rnams kyi nyon mongs pa grangs med pa zhi bar byed cing /
analyzed: de 'di snyam du bla na med pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos sems can rnams kyi nyon mongs pa grangs med pa zhi bar byed cing /
translated: They think, “The unsurpassed buddhadharma pacifies the countless afflictions of sentient beings and🔽becomes the meaning of happiness and benefit.

original: bde ba dang / phan pa'i don du 'gyur ba 'di  sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' 'ba' zhig gis yun ring du gnas shing mi nub par mdzad de /
analyzed: bde ba dang / phan pa'i don du 'gyur ba 'di  sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' 'ba' zhig gis yun ring du gnas shing mi nub par mdzad de /
translated: Only the buddhas and bodhisattvas can make it remain for a long time and not disappear.

original: da bdag kyang byang chub tu sems bskyed la /🔽sems can @185a *//
analyzed: da bdag kyang byang chub tu sems bskyed la /🔽sems can @185a *//
translated: Now I too will give rise to the mind of awakening.🔽I will make the sublime Dharma remain for a long time and not disappear.”

original: thams cad kyi nyon mongs pa yongs su spangs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: thams cad kyi nyon mongs pa yongs su spangs pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to completely eliminate the afflictions of all,🔽I will experience great suffering in this body, but I will cause the Buddha's teachings to remain in the world for a long time.

original: bdag gi lus 'di sdug bsngal chen po myong yang sangs rgyas kyi chos 'jig rten na yun ring du gnas par bya'o snyam sems nas byang chub tu sems bskyed pa dang / kha cig ni sangs rgyas kyi chos 'jig pa ma mthong yang dus ngan pa'i sems can rnams nyon mongs pa shin tu lci ba 'dod chags dang /
analyzed: bdag gi lus 'di sdug bsngal chen po myong yang sangs rgyas kyi chos 'jig rten na yun ring du gnas par bya'o snyam sems nas byang chub tu sems bskyed pa dang / kha cig ni sangs rgyas kyi chos 'jig pa ma mthong yang dus ngan pa'i sems can rnams nyon mongs pa shin tu lci ba 'dod chags dang /
translated: Some, even though they do not see the destruction of the Buddha's teachings, see that sentient beings in this degenerate age have heavy afflictions, such as attachment,

original: zhe sdang dang / gti mug rnams dang / ngo tsha med pa dang / khrel med pa dang / ser sna rnams dang / phrag dog dang / khong khro ba dang / 'khrugs pa rnams dang / ma dad pa dang / the tshom dang / le lo la sogs pa nyon mongs pa'i dngos po 'di dag mthong na /
analyzed: zhe sdang dang / gti mug rnams dang / ngo tsha med pa dang / khrel med pa dang / ser sna rnams dang / phrag dog dang / khong khro ba dang / 'khrugs pa rnams dang / ma dad pa dang / the tshom dang / le lo la sogs pa nyon mongs pa'i dngos po 'di dag mthong na /
translated: aversion, and delusion, as well as shamelessness, lack of embarrassment, stinginess, jealousy, anger, agitation, lack of faith, doubt, laziness, and so forth.

original: de 'di snyam du shin tu dus ngan pas sems can 'di dag ni dge ba mi spyod de /
analyzed: de 'di snyam du shin tu dus ngan pas sems can 'di dag ni dge ba mi spyod de /
translated: Seeing these things, they think, In this extremely degenerate age, these sentient beings do not engage in virtue.

original: de ltar dus ngan pas theg pa gnyis kyi sems kyang skyed mi nus na /
analyzed: de ltar dus ngan pas theg pa gnyis kyi sems kyang skyed mi nus na /
translated: In this degenerate age, people are unable to generate the mind of the two vehicles,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa lta ci smos snyam sems nas /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa lta ci smos snyam sems nas /
translated: let alone generate the mind of unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'o //
translated: Thus, they generate the mind of enlightenment.

original: de ltar byang chub tu sems bskyed nas sems can thams cad kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa la brtson par byed do //
analyzed: de ltar byang chub tu sems bskyed nas sems can thams cad kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa la brtson par byed do //
translated: Having generated the mind of enlightenment in this way, they strive to cause all sentient beings to generate the mind of unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' dga' ba'i rgyal pos /
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' dga' ba'i rgyal pos /
translated: Then, the bodhisattva Nanda-rāja

original: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: addressed the Blessed One as follows:

original: @185b bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: @185b bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: byang chub sems dpa' drin lan shes pa ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' drin lan shes pa ni /
translated: the bodhisattva who knows gratitude

original: bdag byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: bdag byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'o //
translated: generates the mind of enlightenment for himself.

original: byang chub sems dpa' drin lan bsab pa ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' drin lan bsab pa ni /
translated: The bodhisattva who repays kindness

original: sems can pha rol po byang chub tu sems bskyed du bcug pa'o zhes bgyi na /
analyzed: sems can pha rol po byang chub tu sems bskyed du bcug pa'o zhes bgyi na /
translated: causes other sentient beings to generate the mind of enlightenment.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa sngon 'khor ba na 'khor ba'i che thog ma dngos po ci'i rgyus byang chub tu sems bskyed par gyur /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa sngon 'khor ba na 'khor ba'i che thog ma dngos po ci'i rgyus byang chub tu sems bskyed par gyur /
translated: What was the cause for the Tathāgata to generate the mind of enlightenment while transmigrating in cyclic existence in the past?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavān replied:

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family!

original: sngon gyi bskal ba grangs med pa'i bar du skye shir 'khor ba na 'khor zhing /
analyzed: sngon gyi bskal ba grangs med pa'i bar du skye shir 'khor ba na 'khor zhing /
translated: In the past, for countless eons, while transmigrating in cyclic existence through birth and death,

original: lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi nyon mongs pa'i las chen pos sems can dmyal ba chen po brgyad myong bar 'gyur to //
analyzed: lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi nyon mongs pa'i las chen pos sems can dmyal ba chen po brgyad myong bar 'gyur to //
translated: through the great afflictive karma of body, speech, and mind, I experienced the eight great hells.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: aa ha ha'i sems can dmyal ba dang / aa la la'i sems can dmyal ba dang / aa tsa tsa'i sems can dmyal ba dang / zangs khol ma'i sems can dmyal ba dang / zangs khol ba chen po'i sems can dmyal ba dang / rdo nag po'i sems can dmyal ba ba dang /
analyzed: aa ha ha'i sems can dmyal ba dang / aa la la'i sems can dmyal ba dang / aa tsa tsa'i sems can dmyal ba dang / zangs khol ma'i sems can dmyal ba dang / zangs khol ba chen po'i sems can dmyal ba dang / rdo nag po'i sems can dmyal ba ba dang /
translated: the Ahha hell, the Ahaha hell, the Atsa tsa hell, the boiling copper hell, the great boiling copper hell, the black stone hell,

original: rdo nag po chen po'i sems can dmyal ba nas /
analyzed: rdo nag po chen po'i sems can dmyal ba nas /
translated: the great black stone hell,

original: me'i shing rta'i dmyal ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: me'i shing rta'i dmyal ba'i bar du'o //
translated: and up to the fire-chariot hell.

original: nga de'i tshe na me'i shing rta'i dmyal bar lhung nas /
analyzed: nga de'i tshe na me'i shing rta'i dmyal bar lhung nas /
translated: At that time, I fell into the hell of the fire-drawn cart.

original: gud nas gcig dang / gnyis kyis me'i shing rta 'dren te /
analyzed: gud nas gcig dang / gnyis kyis me'i shing rta 'dren te /
translated: One, two, and three others pulled the fire-drawn cart.

original: dmyal ba'i srung ma aa bang ni shing rti'i steng na 'dug cing mig bgrad /
analyzed: dmyal ba'i srung ma aa bang ni shing rti'i steng na 'dug cing mig bgrad /
translated: The hell guardian Avīci sat on top of the cart, his eyes bulging,

original: so gcigs te me 'bud pa kha dang / mig dang / rna ba dang / sna nas me 'bar /
analyzed: so gcigs te me 'bud pa kha dang / mig dang / rna ba dang / sna nas me 'bar /
translated: his teeth bared, and fire blazing from his mouth, eyes, ears, and nose.

original: dud pa @186a *//
analyzed: dud pa @186a *//
translated: Smoke

original: thul te / srung ma de yang lus shin tu che zhing gnag la /
analyzed: thul te / srung ma de yang lus shin tu che zhing gnag la /

original: shing rta'i steng na skyil mo krung bcas te 'dug nas /
analyzed: shing rta'i steng na skyil mo krung bcas te 'dug nas /
translated: He sat cross-legged on top of the cart.

original: lag pa na lcags kyi dbyug pa thogs te nga la rdeg go /
analyzed: lag pa na lcags kyi dbyug pa thogs te nga la rdeg go /
translated: He held an iron club in his hand and beat me.

original: de'i tshe ngan pa'i sdug bsngal ma bzod nas stobs ci nus kyis shing rta drangs so //
analyzed: de'i tshe ngan pa'i sdug bsngal ma bzod nas stobs ci nus kyis shing rta drangs so //
translated: At that time, unable to bear the suffering of evil, I pulled the cart with all my might.

original: nga'i grogs shig nyam chung ste 'dren ma nus pas dmyal ba'i srung ma aa pang gis lcags kyi mdung rtse gsum pa thogs nas brang du btsugs te /
analyzed: nga'i grogs shig nyam chung ste 'dren ma nus pas dmyal ba'i srung ma aa pang gis lcags kyi mdung rtse gsum pa thogs nas brang du btsugs te /
translated: One of my companions was weak and could not pull, so the hell guardian Avīci took up a trident and stabbed it into his chest.

original: lcags thos brdegs nas /
analyzed: lcags thos brdegs nas /
translated: He beat him with an iron hammer.

original: khrag char par phab bo //
analyzed: khrag char par phab bo //

analyzed: de'i tshe mi de na ba'i sdug bsngal mi bzod pas na tsha ba'i skad chen po byung nas par 'ga' ni pha ma zhas 'bod /
translated: At that time, the man, unable to bear the suffering of his illness, cried out in a loud voice, “Father! Mother!”

original: bar 'ga' ni chung ma bu zhe bos kyang phan pa med do //
analyzed: bar 'ga' ni chung ma bu zhe bos kyang phan pa med do //
translated: Sometimes he called out for his wife and children, but it was of no use.

analyzed: nga de'i tshe na de lta bu'i sdug bsngal chen po myong ba mthong nas snying rje'i sems skyes so //
translated: At that time, seeing him experiencing such great suffering, a thought of compassion arose in me.

original: de ltar snying rje'i sems chen po skyes pa'i rkyen gyis byang chub tu sems bskyed par gyur to //
analyzed: de ltar snying rje'i sems chen po skyes pa'i rkyen gyis byang chub tu sems bskyed par gyur to //
translated: As a condition for that great thought of compassion, I generated the thought of awakening.

original: de nas sdug bsngal myong ba de'i phyir /
analyzed: de nas sdug bsngal myong ba de'i phyir /
translated: Then, because of experiencing that suffering,🔽I supplicated the hell guardians, “Please generate a little thought of compassion for this man who is experiencing suffering.”

original: dmyal ba'i srung ma aa bang la sdug bsngal myong ba'i mi 'di la snying rje'i sems cung zad skyed cig ces gsol ba btab pa dang / dmyal ba'i srung ma khros nas zhe sdang gi sems skyes pas /
analyzed: dmyal ba'i srung ma aa bang la sdug bsngal myong ba'i mi 'di la snying rje'i sems cung zad skyed cig ces gsol ba btab pa dang / dmyal ba'i srung ma khros nas zhe sdang gi sems skyes pas /
translated: The hell guardians became angry and gave rise to a thought of hatred.

original: lcags kyi mdung rtse gsum pa thogs nas /
analyzed: lcags kyi mdung rtse gsum pa thogs nas /
translated: They took up a trident of iron

original: nga'i gnya' bar btsugs nas /
analyzed: nga'i gnya' bar btsugs nas /
translated: and thrust it into my neck.

analyzed: de'i tshe'i dus byas pas me'i shing rta'i sems can dmyal ba las thar te /
translated: At that time, when his life ended, he was freed from the hell of the Fire Chariot.

original: bskal ba brgya snyed kyi mi @186b dge ba'i sdig pa byang bar gyur to //
analyzed: bskal ba brgya snyed kyi mi @186b dge ba'i sdig pa byang bar gyur to //

original: de ltar ngas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pas /
analyzed: de ltar ngas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pas /
translated: Thus, because I gave rise to the mind of unsurpassed, perfect awakening,

original: me'i shing rta'i sems can dmyal ba las thar bar gyur to //
analyzed: me'i shing rta'i sems can dmyal ba las thar bar gyur to //
translated: I was freed from the hell of the Fire Chariot.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis dga' ba'i rgyal po la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis dga' ba'i rgyal po la bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavān said to King Nandamitra:

original: de'i tshe me'i shing rta 'drin pa de ni da ltar nga yin te /
analyzed: de'i tshe me'i shing rta 'drin pa de ni da ltar nga yin te /
translated: “At that time, the one who pulled the Fire Chariot is now me.

analyzed: byang chub tu sems bskyed pas myur du sangs rgyas su grub par gyur to //
translated: Because I gave rise to the mind of awakening, I quickly accomplished buddhahood.

original: de bas na sems can thams cad kyis byang chub tu sems bskyed pa ni /
analyzed: de bas na sems can thams cad kyis byang chub tu sems bskyed pa ni /
translated: Therefore, for all sentient beings, giving rise to the mind of awakening

original: don gyi dngos po ni gcig tu ma zad de /🔽la la ni snying rje'i rkyen gyis skye'o //
analyzed: don gyi dngos po ni gcig tu ma zad de / la la ni snying rje'i rkyen gyis skye'o //
translated: is not just a single thing.🔽Some give rise to it through the condition of compassion.

original: la la ni zhe sdang gi rkyen gyis skye'o //
analyzed: la la ni zhe sdang gi rkyen gyis skye'o //
translated: Some give rise to it through the condition of hatred.

original: la la ni sbyin pa'i rkyen gyis skye'o //
analyzed: la la ni sbyin pa'i rkyen gyis skye'o //
translated: Some are born through the condition of generosity.

original: la la ni ser sna'i rkyen gyis skye'o //
analyzed: la la ni ser sna'i rkyen gyis skye'o //
translated: Some are born through the condition of stinginess.

original: la la ni dga' ba'i rkyen gyis skye'o //
analyzed: la la ni dga' ba'i rkyen gyis skye'o //
translated: Some are born through the condition of joy.

original: la la ni mya ngan gyi rkyen gyis skye'o //
analyzed: la la ni mya ngan gyi rkyen gyis skye'o //
translated: Some are born through the condition of sorrow.🔽Some are born through the condition of being separated from what is desired.

analyzed: la la ni 'dod pa dang bye bral gyi rkyen gyis skye'o; ;la la ni dgra sdang ba dang phrad pa'i rkyen gyis skye'o //

analyzed: la la ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen la sten pa'i rkyen gyis skye'o //

original: la la ni mi dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi rkyen gyis skye'o //
analyzed: la la ni mi dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi rkyen gyis skye'o //
translated: Some are born through the condition of an unvirtuous friend.

original: la la ni sangs rgyas mthong ba'i rkyen gyis skye'o //
analyzed: la la ni sangs rgyas mthong ba'i rkyen gyis skye'o //
translated: Some are born through the condition of seeing the Buddha.

original: la la ni chos thos pa'i rkyen gyis skye'o //
analyzed: la la ni chos thos pa'i rkyen gyis skye'o //
translated: Some are born through the condition of hearing the Dharma.

original: de bas na sems can rnams la byang chub tu sems bskyed pa ni de ltar so sor mi mthun te /
analyzed: de bas na sems can rnams la byang chub tu sems bskyed pa ni de ltar so sor mi mthun te /
translated: Therefore, the generation of the mind of awakening in sentient beings is like that, not uniform.

original: dga' ba'i rgyal po /
analyzed: dga' ba'i rgyal po /
translated: King of Joy,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos /
translated: the bodhisattva mahāsattva

original: drin lan shes pa dang / drin lan bsab pa'i don gyi dngos po 'di ltar rig par bya'o //🔽de'i tshe chos 'di bstan @187a *//
analyzed: drin lan shes pa dang / drin lan bsab pa'i don gyi dngos po 'di ltar rig par bya'o // de'i tshe chos 'di bstan @187a *//
translated: One should know that the meaning of being grateful and repaying kindness is like this.

analyzed: pa na skye bo khri brgya stong snyed kyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed par gyur to //
translated: At that time, when this Dharma was taught, many hundreds of thousands of people generated the intention to achieve unsurpassable, perfect enlightenment.

original: 'khor mang po de dag las la la ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob pa nas /
analyzed: 'khor mang po de dag las la la ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob pa nas /
translated: Among that great assembly, some attained the fruit of stream enterer up to

analyzed: dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu'i bar du thob par gyur to //
translated: the fruit of arhat.

analyzed: lha dang / klu dang / yi dvags dang / mi dang / mi ma yin pa la sogs pa thams cad nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas su sems bskyed par gyur te /
translated: All the gods, nāgas, hungry ghosts, humans, non-humans, and so forth generated the intention to achieve the enlightenment of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

analyzed: chos thos pa la rab tu dga' rangs nas mgo bos phyag btsal te /
translated: Having rejoiced in hearing the Dharma, they bowed their heads in homage,🔽circumambulated to the right, and departed.

original: g-yas phyogs nas bskor ba byas nas phyir dong ngo; ;thabs la mkhas pa chen po sangs rgyas drin lan bsab pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: g-yas phyogs nas bskor ba byas nas phyir dong ngo; ;thabs la mkhas pa chen po sangs rgyas drin lan bsab pa'i mdo las /
translated: From the Great Skill in Means Sūtra, the Buddha Repaying Kindness,

original: byang chub tu sems bskyed pa zhes bya ba'i le'u ste bzhi pa'o ////
analyzed: byang chub tu sems bskyed pa zhes bya ba'i le'u ste bzhi pa'o ////
translated: This concludes the fourth chapter, on the generation of the mind of enlightenment.

original: bam po gsum pa /
analyzed: bam po gsum pa /
translated: Chapter V

original: de'i tshe de bzhin gshegs pa'i yum lha mdzes dang / lha rnams kyi don du zhag dgu bcu'i bar du lha rnams la chos ston tu gshegs te /
analyzed: de'i tshe de bzhin gshegs pa'i yum lha mdzes dang / lha rnams kyi don du zhag dgu bcu'i bar du lha rnams la chos ston tu gshegs te /
translated: At that time, the mother of the Tathāgata, Māyādevī, went to teach the Dharma to the gods for ninety days.

analyzed: 'jam bu'i gling gi mi rnams zhag dgu bcu'i bar du de bzhin gshegs pa ga la bzhugs pa ma rtogs so //
translated: The people of Jambudvīpa did not know where the Tathāgata was for ninety days.

original: mo'u 'gal gyi bu chen po rdzu 'phrul gyi mchog tu gyur pas kyang /
analyzed: mo'u 'gal gyi bu chen po rdzu 'phrul gyi mchog tu gyur pas kyang /
translated: The great Maudgalyāyana, who was foremost in miraculous abilities,

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi mthus gtugs te /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi mthus gtugs te /
translated: exhausted his miraculous powers.

original: phyogs bcur brtags kyang ma rtogs so //
analyzed: phyogs bcur brtags kyang ma rtogs so //
translated: He searched in the ten directions but did not find him.

original: 'phags pa nye bar skyong lta bu lha'i mig mchog gis phyogs bcur stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kun tu bltas kyang ma mthong @187b to; ;de bzhin du 'phags pa'i 'khor lnga brgya'i bar du kun gyis brtags kyang ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: 'phags pa nye bar skyong lta bu lha'i mig mchog gis phyogs bcur stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kun tu bltas kyang ma mthong @187b to; ;de bzhin du 'phags pa'i 'khor lnga brgya'i bar du kun gyis brtags kyang ma mthong ngo //
translated: The noble Upāli, with his supreme divine eye, looked throughout the worlds of the great trichiliocosm in the ten directions but did not see him. In the same way, the five hundred noble disciples all searched but did not see him.

original: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa ma mthong bas de dag mi dga' ste /
analyzed: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa ma mthong bas de dag mi dga' ste /
translated: Not seeing the Tathāgata, they were unhappy.

original: mya ngan gyis sems gdungs par gyur to //
analyzed: mya ngan gyis sems gdungs par gyur to //
translated: Their minds were tormented by grief.

original: de'i tshe rgyal po au tra ya nas de bzhin gshegs pa ma mthong bas mi dga' ba'i sems skyes te /
analyzed: de'i tshe rgyal po au tra ya nas de bzhin gshegs pa ma mthong bas mi dga' ba'i sems skyes te /
translated: At that time, King Udayana, not seeing the Tathāgata, gave rise to an unhappy mind.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dran pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dran pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to remember the Tathāgata,

original: glang mgo'i shing tsandan las de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gzugs byas nas phyag 'tshal ba dang / mchod pa byed pa de yang de bzhin gshegs pa mngon sum dang 'dra bar bzhugs par dmigs nas mchod pa byas so //
analyzed: glang mgo'i shing tsandan las de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gzugs byas nas phyag 'tshal ba dang / mchod pa byed pa de yang de bzhin gshegs pa mngon sum dang 'dra bar bzhugs par dmigs nas mchod pa byas so //
translated: he made an image of the Tathāgata's body from gośīrṣa sandalwood. He made prostrations and offerings, and also made offerings to it, visualizing it as if the Tathāgata were actually present.

original: de'i tshe rgyal po chen pos mu stegs can gyi ston pa drug pos nas /
analyzed: de'i tshe rgyal po chen pos mu stegs can gyi ston pa drug pos nas /
translated: At that time, the great king asked the six non-Buddhist teachers,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa da ltar ga la bzhugs zhes dris na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa da ltar ga la bzhugs zhes dris na /
translated: Where is the Tathāgata now?

original: ston pa drug gis rgyal po la 'di skad smras so //
analyzed: ston pa drug gis rgyal po la 'di skad smras so //
translated: The six teachers said to the king,

original: rgyal po chen po /
analyzed: rgyal po chen po /
translated: Great King,

original: mi mkhyen nam /
analyzed: mi mkhyen nam /
translated: do you not know?

original: dge sbyong goo ta ma ni sgyu 'phrul can yin te /
analyzed: dge sbyong goo ta ma ni sgyu 'phrul can yin te /
translated: The ascetic Gautama is a magician.

original: sgyu ma'o // sgyu 'phrul gyi sgyu ma ni bden pa'i dngos po med pas /🔽bdag cag gi gtsug lag las lo stong ngam /
analyzed: sgyu ma'o // sgyu 'phrul gyi sgyu ma ni bden pa'i dngos po med pas / bdag cag gi gtsug lag las lo stong ngam /
translated: The illusion of a magical creation is not a real thing.

original: nyis stong na sgyu 'phrul can sgyu ma zhig 'byung ngo zhes 'chad pas /
analyzed: nyis stong na sgyu 'phrul can sgyu ma zhig 'byung ngo zhes 'chad pas /
translated: In our scriptures it is said that once every thousand or two thousand years, a magician will appear who can create an illusion.

original: dge sbyong goo ta ma ni sgyu ma de kho na yin no //
analyzed: dge sbyong goo ta ma ni sgyu ma de kho na yin no //
translated: The ascetic Gautama is just such a magician.

original: de'i tshe 'phags pa nye bar skyod rgyal po chen po ga la bar song nas rgyal po la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de'i tshe 'phags pa nye bar skyod rgyal po chen po ga la bar song nas rgyal po la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: At that time, the noble Upasena went to the great king and said to him,

original: rgyal po chen po mkhyen tam /
analyzed: rgyal po chen po mkhyen tam /
translated: “Great king, do you know this?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni da ste zhag bdun na sum cu rtsa gsum gnam nas @188a *//
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni da ste zhag bdun na sum cu rtsa gsum gnam nas @188a *//
translated: In seven days from now, the Tathāgata will descend from the Heaven of the Thirty-Three

original: 'dzam bu'i gling du gshegs so //
analyzed: 'dzam bu'i gling du gshegs so //
translated: to Jambudvīpa.

original: rgyal pos de skad ces smras pa thos nas rab tu dga' ba'i sems su gyur te /
analyzed: rgyal pos de skad ces smras pa thos nas rab tu dga' ba'i sems su gyur te /
translated: When the king heard this, he was overjoyed.

original: yul mi bsdus nas chag chag dang / phyag dar byas te /
analyzed: yul mi bsdus nas chag chag dang / phyag dar byas te /

original: spos dang / me tog kyang bshams /

analyzed: de'i tha chung ni zas zil mngar gyi zas zhes bya'o //

analyzed: da ste zhag bdun na 'dzam bu'i gling du gshegs so //

analyzed: byang chub kyi shing drung na 'dug 'dug nas /

analyzed: nga ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes thob bo zhes zer te; tshig de ni rdzun te bden pa ma yin no //

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: rgyal po aa khyi tas bsod snyoms sbyin par bos nas /

analyzed: yang kun dga' bo la kun dga' ra ba na bya mang po ci'i phyir ca co'i skad 'byin ces dris na /

original: de cis mngon zhe na /
analyzed: de cis mngon zhe na /

analyzed: btsun mo skye dgu'i bdag mo sdug bsngal chen po myong bar byas pas / drin mi shes shing @190a *//
translated: He made Queen Mahāprajāpatī experience great suffering.

original: drin mi dran pa yin no //
analyzed: drin mi dran pa yin no //

analyzed: dge sbyong goo ta ma'i 'khor ni bzang ngan med de /

translated: Even his five hundred disciples each say, ‘I am supreme.’🔽The preceptor has no religious system,🔽and his disciples have no religious system or

original: spyod pa'i las med do //
analyzed: spyod pa'i las med do //
translated: practice.

translated: Even Śāriputra, who had a sharp mind, great wisdom, and the best of intelligence, was among them.🔽Even the monk who was the least intelligent, who was ignorant, and who was like a post, was among them.

analyzed: chung ngu na 'dod chags chung ba dge slong ma grags 'dzin yang de la 'jug /

original: chung ngu na shed ma bye ba shes pa med pa /
analyzed: chung ngu na shed ma bye ba shes pa med pa /
translated: Even the infant who was not yet able to walk, who was ignorant,

original: bus pa tsun da yang de la 'jug /
analyzed: bus pa tsun da yang de la 'jug /

analyzed: nang gi rgas 'khogs pa de su bar ta la zhes bya ba lo brgya nyi shu lon pa de yang de la 'jug /
translated: Even the oldest of the old, the one who was one hundred and twenty years old, was among them.

original: rigs btsun pa che ba sh'aka ris kyang de la 'jug /
analyzed: rigs btsun pa che ba sh'aka ris kyang de la 'jug /
translated: Even the Śākya clan, which was of the highest and most noble lineage, was among them.

original: mnyan du yod pa na nang gi rigs ngan phyag dar lung skyed pa yang de la 'jug ste /
analyzed: mnyan du yod pa na nang gi rigs ngan phyag dar lung skyed pa yang de la 'jug ste /
translated: In Śrāvastī, even the lowest of the low, the untouchables, are included in this.

analyzed: de bas na dge sbyong goo ta ma'i chos ni go 'dun bsdus pa bzang ngan med pa ste / mchod par 'os pa'am /

original: bkur sti bya ba'i gnas ma yin no //
analyzed: bkur sti bya ba'i gnas ma yin no //
translated: They are not worthy of respect.

original: dper na / rlung chen po langs na shing lo @190b ma'am; 'dab ma thams cad lhan cig 'phungs pa ltar sangs rgyas kyi chos kyang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: dper na / rlung chen po langs na shing lo @190b ma'am; 'dab ma thams cad lhan cig 'phungs pa ltar sangs rgyas kyi chos kyang de dang 'dra'o //

original: dper na / bya mang po ni mis bor ba'i kha zas sam /
analyzed: dper na / bya mang po ni mis bor ba'i kha zas sam /
translated: Just as many birds gather around food or molasses that a person has discarded,

analyzed: bar bur la 'du ba ltar; dge sbyong goo ta ma'i 'khor yang de dang 'dra ste /

original: rnyed rnyed len cing za'o //
analyzed: rnyed rnyed len cing za'o //
translated: They gather and eat whatever they can get.🔽Therefore, why do you think that the ascetic Gautama is worthy of offerings?”

original: de bas na khyed rnams ci'i phyir dge sbyong goo ta ma la mchod pa bya bar sems zhes bsgrags so; ;de'i tshe na mi mang pos de skad smras pa thos kyang /
analyzed: de bas na khyed rnams ci'i phyir dge sbyong goo ta ma la mchod pa bya bar sems zhes bsgrags so; ;de'i tshe na mi mang pos de skad smras pa thos kyang /
translated: At that time, although many people heard such talk,

original: dper na / sa chen po bskyod du med pa bzhin /
analyzed: dper na / sa chen po bskyod du med pa bzhin /
translated: It is like the great earth, which cannot be moved.

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la skom pas gdungs pa tsam du mos shing 'dud pa'i sems ma nur to //
translated: In the same way, the Thus-Come One, with a mind that is not swayed by the slightest thirst,

analyzed: 'khor mang po rnams su mu stegs can gyi ston pa drug gis smras pa'i tshig gis sems phyir ma nur ba ni ji ltar rdo rje ltar brtan par gyur te /

analyzed: skyed bri med pa de bzhin gshegs pa la skom pas gdungs pa ltar /
translated: The Thus-Come One, who is without increase or decrease, is like one tormented by thirst.

original: mos shing dad pas zhag bdun lon nas /
analyzed: mos shing dad pas zhag bdun lon nas /
