original: de bzhin gshegs pa yang sum cu rtsa gsum gnam nas slar 'dzam bu'i gling du gshegs te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa yang sum cu rtsa gsum gnam nas slar 'dzam bu'i gling du gshegs te /
translated: The Thus-Come One, from the Heaven of the Thirty-three, has now returned to Jambudvīpa.

original: lha'i 'khor grangs med pa brgya stong gis bskor cing /
analyzed: lha'i 'khor grangs med pa brgya stong gis bskor cing /
translated: He is surrounded by countless hundreds of thousands of celestial retinues.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'od zer gyis kun tu snang la gsal bar byas nas /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'od zer gyis kun tu snang la gsal bar byas nas /
translated: The light of the Thus-Come One shines everywhere, illuminating all.

original: lha'i rol mo tshad med pa brgya stong snyed kyis mchod nas lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen @191a *//
analyzed: lha'i rol mo tshad med pa brgya stong snyed kyis mchod nas lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen @191a *//
translated: They made offerings with countless hundreds of thousands of divine musical instruments and then said to the Blessed One, “Blessed One, please teach the Dharma.🔽

original: po dang / mi dang / mi ma yin pa'i bar du thams cad 'dus te phyag btsal nas mchod pa byas so //
analyzed: po dang / mi dang / mi ma yin pa'i bar du thams cad 'dus te phyag btsal nas mchod pa byas so //
translated: They made offerings with countless hundreds of thousands of divine musical instruments, and then all the gods, nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, mahoragas, humans, and non-humans gathered, bowed down, and made offerings.

original: de'i tshe rgyal po au tra ya na yang 'khor dang bcas te; rgyang ma nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i zhabs la phyag btsal nas phyogs gcig tu 'khod do //
analyzed: de'i tshe rgyal po au tra ya na yang 'khor dang bcas te; rgyang ma nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i zhabs la phyag btsal nas phyogs gcig tu 'khod do //
translated: At that time, King Udayana also came with his retinue, bowed down at the feet of the Tathāgata from afar, and sat to one side.

original: de nas mu stegs can gyi ston pa drug kyang /
analyzed: de nas mu stegs can gyi ston pa drug kyang /
translated: Then the six non-Buddhist teachers

original: phyogs gcig tu 'dus nas 'di snyam du sems par gyur to //
analyzed: phyogs gcig tu 'dus nas 'di snyam du sems par gyur to //
translated: gathered in one place and thought this:

original: bdag cag gi byur zhes bya ba 'dir 'ongs te /
analyzed: bdag cag gi byur zhes bya ba 'dir 'ongs te /
translated: This misfortune has come to us.

original: mi mang po'i nang du de skad ces bsgrags kyang yid ches la ma phan pas /
analyzed: mi mang po'i nang du de skad ces bsgrags kyang yid ches la ma phan pas /
translated: Even though it was proclaimed in the midst of many people, it was not believed and did not help.

original: da ni bdag gis lha dang / mi tshogs pa'i nang du bsgrags na bye brag ma phyed do snyam bsams so //
analyzed: da ni bdag gis lha dang / mi tshogs pa'i nang du bsgrags na bye brag ma phyed do snyam bsams so //
translated: Now, if I were to proclaim this in the midst of the assembly of gods and men, they would not be able to distinguish it.

original: de'i tshe mu stegs can gyi ston pa drug gis de snyam bsams nas /
analyzed: de'i tshe mu stegs can gyi ston pa drug gis de snyam bsams nas /
translated: At that time, the six non-Buddhist teachers thought this,

original: 'khor brgyad stong snyed dang mdun gyis byas te /
analyzed: 'khor brgyad stong snyed dang mdun gyis byas te /
translated: and with a retinue of eight thousand,

original: 'khor mang po 'dus pa'i nang du 'ongs nas /
analyzed: 'khor mang po 'dus pa'i nang du 'ongs nas /
translated: they came to the assembly of the multitude.

original: phyogs gcig tu 'khod do //
analyzed: phyogs gcig tu 'khod do //
translated: They sat to one side.

original: de'i tshe na dri za'i bu chos kyi phreng ba zhes bya ba rin po che sna bdun las byas pa'i pi wang thogs nas de bzhin gshegs pa gang na bar 'ongs te /
analyzed: de'i tshe na dri za'i bu chos kyi phreng ba zhes bya ba rin po che sna bdun las byas pa'i pi wang thogs nas de bzhin gshegs pa gang na bar 'ongs te /
translated: At that time, a gandharva son named Dharma-mālā, holding a vīṇā made of the seven precious substances, came to where the Tathāgata was.

original: zhabs la mgo bos phyag btsal nas phyogs gcig tu 'khod do //
analyzed: zhabs la mgo bos phyag btsal nas phyogs gcig tu 'khod do //
translated: He bowed his head at the feet and sat to one side.

original: phyogs gcig tu 'dug nas glu dang bcas pa'i rol mo byas nas /
analyzed: phyogs gcig tu 'dug nas glu dang bcas pa'i rol mo byas nas /
translated: Sitting to one side, he played music with singing,

original: rol me'i sgra skad shin tu snyan pa des 'khor thams cad kyi yid kyang tshim par gyur te /
analyzed: rol me'i sgra skad shin tu snyan pa des 'khor thams cad kyi yid kyang tshim par gyur te /
translated: and with that very pleasant sound of music, the minds of the entire retinue were satisfied.

original: nyan thos sh'a ri'i @191b bu la sogs pa ma tshor bar lus bskyod cing g-yos te gar byas par gyur /
analyzed: nyan thos sh'a ri'i @191b bu la sogs pa ma tshor bar lus bskyod cing g-yos te gar byas par gyur /
translated: The śrāvakas, Śāriputra and so forth, did not notice that their bodies were shaking and trembling and dancing.

original: ri rab lhun po yang 'gul zhing g-yos par gyur to //
analyzed: ri rab lhun po yang 'gul zhing g-yos par gyur to //
translated: Even Mount Sumeru shook.

original: de'i tshe de bzhin gshegs pa mtshan ma yod ces bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin du zhugs nas /
analyzed: de'i tshe de bzhin gshegs pa mtshan ma yod ces bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin du zhugs nas /
translated: At that time the Tathāgata entered the samādhi called “having signs.”

original: ting nge 'dzin de'i mthus pa'i wang gi sgras stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kun tu grags shing /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de'i mthus pa'i wang gi sgras stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kun tu grags shing /
translated: By the power of that samādhi, the sound of a vīṇā was heard throughout the trichiliocosm.

original: pi wang gi sgra de las sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang / mi rtag pa dang / mi gtsang ba dang / bdag med pa zhes bya ba'i sgra byung ste /
analyzed: pi wang gi sgra de las sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang / mi rtag pa dang / mi gtsang ba dang / bdag med pa zhes bya ba'i sgra byung ste /
translated: From that vīṇā sound came the sounds “suffering,” “empty,” “impermanent,” “impure,” and “no-self.”

original: sems can thams cad kyis rol mo'i sgra de las de bzhin gshegs pas drin gzo ba dang / drin lan bsab pa dang / bskal ba tshad med pa grangs med pa'i bar pha ma la sri zhu bya ba'i sgra grags par gyur to //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyis rol mo'i sgra de las de bzhin gshegs pas drin gzo ba dang / drin lan bsab pa dang / bskal ba tshad med pa grangs med pa'i bar pha ma la sri zhu bya ba'i sgra grags par gyur to //
translated: All sentient beings heard from that musical sound the Tathāgata’s repayment of kindness, his repayment of kindness to his parents for immeasurable, countless eons.

original: sgra de thos pa'i sems can thams cad 'dzam bu'i gling du sangs rgyas gang na ba der lhags nas /
analyzed: sgra de thos pa'i sems can thams cad 'dzam bu'i gling du sangs rgyas gang na ba der lhags nas /
translated: All the sentient beings who heard that sound came to the place where the Buddha was in Jambudvīpa.

original: zhabs la mgo bos phyag btsal te phyogs gcig tu 'khod do //
analyzed: zhabs la mgo bos phyag btsal te phyogs gcig tu 'khod do //
translated: They bowed their heads to his feet and sat to one side.

original: de'i tshe de bzhin gshegs pa ting nge 'dzin du zhugs pa la /
analyzed: de'i tshe de bzhin gshegs pa ting nge 'dzin du zhugs pa la /
translated: At that time, the Tathāgata was absorbed in samādhi.

original: 'khor mang po rnams mig mi 'dzum par de bzhin gshegs pa la lta zhing cang mi smra bar 'khong pa las /
analyzed: 'khor mang po rnams mig mi 'dzum par de bzhin gshegs pa la lta zhing cang mi smra bar 'khong pa las /
translated: The many in the retinue looked at the Tathāgata with unblinking eyes, and sat in silence.

original: 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor de nyid du rin po che sna bdun las byas pa'i mchod rten /
analyzed: 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor de nyid du rin po che sna bdun las byas pa'i mchod rten /
translated: In that very maṇḍala of the retinue, a stūpa made of the seven precious substances

original: rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan grangs med pas brgyan pa rin po che'i dril bu brgya stong gis btags pa /
analyzed: rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan grangs med pas brgyan pa rin po che'i dril bu brgya stong gis btags pa /
translated: was adorned with countless victory banners and flags, and hung with hundreds of thousands of precious bells.

original: @192a *// rlung gis bskyod na shin tu sgra snyan pa 'byung ba /
analyzed: @192a *// rlung gis bskyod na shin tu sgra snyan pa 'byung ba /
translated: When stirred by the wind, it produced a very pleasant sound.

original: sa'i nang nas byung ba nam mkha' la 'phags te gnas so //
analyzed: sa'i nang nas byung ba nam mkha' la 'phags te gnas so //
translated: It rose from the ground and floated in the sky.

original: de'i tshe 'khor mang po thams cad rin po che'i mchod rten sa las byung ba de la the tshom du gyur te /
analyzed: de'i tshe 'khor mang po thams cad rin po che'i mchod rten sa las byung ba de la the tshom du gyur te /
translated: At that time, the entire assembly of followers had doubts about the jeweled stūpa that had arisen from the earth.

original: ci'i rgyu ci'i rkyen gyis rin po che'i mchod rten 'di lta bu sa las byung snyam the tshom du gyur te /
analyzed: ci'i rgyu ci'i rkyen gyis rin po che'i mchod rten 'di lta bu sa las byung snyam the tshom du gyur te /
translated: What was the cause and what were the conditions for the appearance of such a jeweled stūpa from the earth?

original: sh'a ri'i bu la sogs pa'i shes pa'i blos gtugs te brtags kyang ma rtogs /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu la sogs pa'i shes pa'i blos gtugs te brtags kyang ma rtogs /
translated: They had doubts, and they consulted with Śāriputra and others, but they did not understand.

original: mi mjed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams nyid na gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byams pa'i bar du yang ma rtogs so //
analyzed: mi mjed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams nyid na gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byams pa'i bar du yang ma rtogs so //
translated: Even the bodhisattva mahāsattva Maitreya, who resided in the Sahā world system, did not understand.

original: de nas mu stegs can gyi ston pa drug 'di snyam du sems par gyur te /
analyzed: de nas mu stegs can gyi ston pa drug 'di snyam du sems par gyur te /
translated: Then the six non-Buddhist teachers had this thought:

original: ci'i rgyu ci'i rkyen gyis rin po che'i mchod rten 'di lta bu byung bar gyur pa mi gzhan zhig gis gal te bdag cag la dris la /
analyzed: ci'i rgyu ci'i rkyen gyis rin po che'i mchod rten 'di lta bu byung bar gyur pa mi gzhan zhig gis gal te bdag cag la dris la /
translated: What is the cause and what are the conditions for the appearance of such a jeweled stūpa? If someone were to ask us,

original: ci de bdag gis ma shes na /
analyzed: ci de bdag gis ma shes na /
translated: if we did not know,

original: thams cad mthong zhing shes pa zhes kyang ji skad bya //
analyzed: thams cad mthong zhing shes pa zhes kyang ji skad bya //
translated: how could we say that we see and know everything?

original: da dge sbyong goo ta mas 'khor mang po la myur du bstan cing bshad na /
analyzed: da dge sbyong goo ta mas 'khor mang po la myur du bstan cing bshad na /
translated: It would be good if the ascetic Gautama would quickly teach and explain to the great assembly.

original: ci ma rung snyam par sems par gyur to //
analyzed: ci ma rung snyam par sems par gyur to //
translated: Thus he thought.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das ting nge 'dzin de las bzhengs pa dang / brgya byin lha'i dbang po sum cu rtsa gsum gnam gyi lha dang / seng ge'i khri bshams te /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das ting nge 'dzin de las bzhengs pa dang / brgya byin lha'i dbang po sum cu rtsa gsum gnam gyi lha dang / seng ge'i khri bshams te /
translated: Then, when the Bhagavān arose from that samādhi, Śakra, Lord of the Gods, the gods of the Heaven of the Thirty-Three, and the gods of the Heaven of the Four Great Kings arranged a lion throne,

original: lha rdzas kyi gos bting ngo //
analyzed: lha rdzas kyi gos bting ngo //
translated: and spread divine cloth upon it.🔽Then the Tathāgata sat cross-legged upon the lion throne,

original: de nas de bzhin gshegs pa seng ge'i khri @192b la ji ltar ri rab lhun po rgya mtsho'i nang na gnas pa bzhin /🔽skyil mo krung bcas nas bzhugs so //
analyzed: de nas de bzhin gshegs pa seng ge'i khri @192b la ji ltar ri rab lhun po rgya mtsho'i nang na gnas pa bzhin / skyil mo krung bcas nas bzhugs so //
translated: like Mount Sumeru standing in the ocean.

original: de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' byams pas 'khor mang po the tshom du byung ba yang sems kyis shes /
analyzed: de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' byams pas 'khor mang po the tshom du byung ba yang sems kyis shes /
translated: At that time, the bodhisattva Maitreya, knowing that the great assembly had doubts,

original: bdag kyang the tshom du gyur te ma rtogs pas stan las langs nas sangs rgyas gang na ba logs su zhabs la mgo bos phyag btsal nas thal mo sbyar ba btud de /
analyzed: bdag kyang the tshom du gyur te ma rtogs pas stan las langs nas sangs rgyas gang na ba logs su zhabs la mgo bos phyag btsal nas thal mo sbyar ba btud de /
translated: and himself having doubts and not understanding, rose from his seat, went to where the Buddha was, bowed his head to the Buddha's feet, joined his palms in reverence,🔽and said to the Buddha, Bhagavān, I have been attending to the Buddha for a long time, and have never seen or heard of such a thing as this.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,
